name: Palta
description:
Palta is a thriving family of Wellbeing and HealthTech brands. We partner with ambitious founders and exceptional talent to transform innovative ideas into life-changing apps that make a positive impact at a global scale.

With over 700 employees on board, our offices stretch across the UK, US, EU and Israel.

company_updates_collection.description:
January is here, meaning #bluemonday  - the saddest day of the year- is around the corner. 

This time of year, many people find themselves in freezing temperatures, with very short hours of sun and daylight, all whilst trying to stay motivated and keep up with their New Year’s resolutions. 

WeatherWell app (part of Palta's family of brands) helps users stay in tune with their health and mood shifts by combining world class weather predictions with scientific algorithms and medical expertise.

WeatherWell latest study on Weather Sensitivity explores exactly how the weather may affect your health. 

Check out the full story here: https://lnkd.in/e9TkJmy7
Our Head of Mindfulness shares some insights and wisdom 🧘🏻♀️
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Board Advisor & Head of Mindfulness @ Palta ||| Shaolin Master | Philosopher | Strategist | Co-Founder | Author | Mentor
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
I’m frequently asked about which strategy principles I apply in what I do and particularly to the projects I work on at Palta.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The following are my 18 strategy principles:
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
1 - master the basics, everything else is built on them
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
2 - always improve and never stop learning, practicing, testing, reviewing
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
3 - create with people who inspire you with their thinking and surpass you in their specialties
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
4 - never compromise integrity, it’s the only basis of lasting and meaningful results
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
5 - harness your unique strengths and develop them tirelessly
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
6 - distinguish attentively between gain and loss, one might seem the other or lead to it
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
7 - follow intuition with reason, build reason on intuition
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
8 - notice things which cannot be seen, because the invisible can be as important as the visible
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
9 - pay attention to details, big things often hide in small things
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
10 - strive to do nothing which is of no use, energy and resources are finite 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
11 - be bravely ingenious, never stay in a comfort zone or in comfortable complacency
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
12 - challenge assumptions and biases, especially your own
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
13 - focus
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
14 - don’t confuse strategy with tactics, or a vision with a plan
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
15 - seek only two outcomes, winning or learning
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
16 - analysis must never create paralysis, strategy realization is more about energy than scrutiny
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
17 - remain unfaltering in defeats and humble in successes, both are just steps
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
18 - don’t hurry, don’t stop.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: CEO & Board Member at Palta / Founder & President at Flo Health, Inc.
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Lensa AI
#1 AppStore USA by Downloads
#1 AppStore USA by Revenue
+ a lot of other countries too

This week has started with #Lensa being both the most downloaded and the top-grossing app on the iOS US App Store.

It’s been great to watch Palta’s very own @Prisma Labs #Lensa.AI app make waves around the world and reach a major breakthrough in a matter of days. 

What has been even more rewarding is to learn that #Lensa’s Magic Avatars feature has inspired people from all over the world in many unique ways. 
For some, Magic Avatars provided a small but much-needed, confidence boost. For others, it was a great chance to see oneself from an unusual angle, experiment with a future hairdo, or clothing style, or maybe even get motivated to remain on a fitness journey. 

I see #Lensa achieving something much more important here: 
The app’s latest feature, Magic Avatars has pushed us out of a vicious circle of filtering, airbrushing, enhancing our own images to consciously hide imperfections and achieve a “certain look” - all these to ultimately gain approval on Social.  Magic Avatars’ experience is a personal one. It is meant to invite one to exercise imagination, encounter various unconventional interpretations of oneself, and choose the ones that resonate with oneself the most.
The end result is always unique, ingenious and always very human.

@Prisma Lab’s team had been on a mission to defy trends and develop a product beyond yet another photo-editing feature, for a number of years, before the successful release of Magic Avatars last month. 
What is more important - It resonates well with users - the app is enjoying outstanding feedback on the app store, landing today at over 50,000 5-star reviews, according to SensorTower. 

Myself along with a wider team here at Palta value an opportunity to support @Prisma Lab’s on this long 6-year journey from day one,  and help it realize its true potential, while navigating together through some of the most complex, thought-provoking, and inspiring areas of the tech industry.

company_updates_collection.description:
We at Palta believe that things such as human wellbeing, happiness and ultimately success rely on many different aspects of life beyond physical activity and awareness.

Here is an example - imagination.

Walter Gjergja, Palta’s Head of Mindfulness summarised it aptly, ”Imagination and creativity are two cornerstones of human intelligence and the elusive concept of consciousness. They define our unique ability to lucid dream - a process which has been scientifically proven to further enhance both abstract thinking and creativity - thus, becoming a perpetual source of inspiration for ourselves”.

Prisma Labs, Inc. #Lensa AI’s new feature, Magic Avatars, invites users to re-imagine themselves as a Sci-Fi character, a Superhero, an Adventurer, a Rockstar or even a Mystical Being. It offers a fun and playful glimpse into what one could look like by processing existing images and converting them into imaginative, artistic depictions.

Today #Lensa AI has hit the No. 1 spot on the iOS App Store thanks to an endless human curiosity and natural drive to imagine and be inspired 💚 
#intelligence #mindfulness #ios #ai #inspiration

Healthy habits: what to do and how to not give up?
We are the lucky ones! Today we have so much information and science-based recommendations to help us stay healthier and have enough energy in our everyday lives.

And together with Andrew Belaveshkin MD PhD, our Medical Advisor at Palta, we are here to outline how to make it easier for us to go healthy and to stick to all the needed recommendations.

Have a look inside and get a motivation boost straight away: https://lnkd.in/dU2qBVZ7

#healthyhabits #healthylifestyle

☃️ It’s that time of year again — the days are getting shorter, the temperatures are dropping, and you may find yourself feeling a little down in the dumps.

If you’re low on energy and motivation when it’s cold out, you’re not alone.

But why does this happen? And is there anything you can do to prevent it?

We talked to the WeatherWell to dive into the reasons and ways not to loose our energy through the winter, please welcome inside: https://lnkd.in/dkfcDvqy

#mentalhealth #weather #motivation #energy #paltaproducts

A little throwback to our talk with Ketty Slonimsky on how to understand if someone is an A-team player or not:

«I believe in such a basic thing — if you don’t have an A-team, you have far fewer chances to succeed. And, of course, we are to hire each time individually depending on the team, the product and the tasks. But if we try to define some principles, we should consider two main things: the candidate should be smart, really-really smart, and hungry, passionate about the ideas and things he does. And he should have both; one of these never works.»
#paltateam #growth

Have you seen what kind of art #Lensaai is making from your photos?

Follow the #lensa to discover all the amazing variations of AI avatars based on real photos. Proud to say Lensa AI is one of Palta's products that has gone viral! Sooo excited to see all the posts around us with the Lensa pictures.

To get your beautifully stylized avatars — here is the AppStore link, try it: https://lnkd.in/d5rX8r2X 

Photo credits: Dmitry Gurski
#ai #art #beauty

Walter Gjergja, Head of Mindfulness at Palta, shared with the subscribers his fundamental learnings from the rapidly accruing decades of life.

It is a highly heartwarming and spirit-lifting speech. Now we are sharing it with you so you can find some valuable ideas to follow.

«...Never give up … don't be afraid to start an apparently impossible journey, one step at a time. Start where you are, use what you have, do the best you can!..»

«...Never compromise your virtues and values. Your virtues and values define who you are: cultivate them and you'll grow yourself, lose them and you'll lose yourself!..»

«...Be grateful. Today. Right now. There is always something to be grateful for; in fact, usually there is much to be grateful for, fortunately...»

For the full text, follow the link: https://lnkd.in/dM6tZcMa
#mindfulness

company_updates_collection.description:
Meet Dmitry Lyubimov 👋  
He started his journey at Palta only few months ago, after coming across a job ad on LinkedIn. Loved the mission, got inspired by the international growth of the company and 💥 boom - the next thing we know he's with us 🧩  

Mitya joined us as a Data Platform Developer at Palta 🧠 Brain - a customized data, analytics, monetization, and payments platform that helps all our products thrive. 

Read on to learn more about Mitya 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories. 

𝘾𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙂𝙋𝙏- 𝙩𝙮𝙥𝙚 𝙦𝙪𝙚𝙨𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣: 𝙋𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙨𝙚 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙡𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖 𝘽𝙧𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙤 𝙢𝙚, 𝙖𝙨 𝙞𝙛 𝙄 𝙖𝙢 𝙖 5 𝙮𝙚𝙖𝙧 𝙤𝙡𝙙.
Okay, imagine you have loads of toys, like different LEGO bricks. And now imagine that for some reason you want to keep all your bricks organized (doesn’t ever happen to your average 5 y.o. 🤷♂️ ) so that you can find them easily when you want to play.  
A data platform is kind of like that large drawer that helps you keep all your information organized and quick to find: all your LEGOs neatly stacked and sorted, brilliant, isn’t it? 
We can also think of Palta Brain as an assistant. It helps startups divide their customers into smaller groups, so that they can approach each group in a unique way.  
To illustrate this, let's pretend you have a bag of sweets, and you wish to share them with your friends (again, why on Earth would you? 🤷♂️ ). You might, however, decide to give your best friend and your cousin different sweets. The same way startups can use Palta Brain to send different messages to different groups of customers. 
 
𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙫𝙞𝙚𝙬 𝙞𝙨 “𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙭𝙩 𝙗𝙞𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜” 𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙚𝙘𝙝?
AI will continue to play an increasingly important role in many industries and aspects of society. If we talk about HealthTech, AI is expected to play a major role in improving the accuracy of diagnoses and medical treatments, streamlining the drug discovery process, and enabling a more personalized approach. 

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙖 𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙡𝙚 𝙘𝙧𝙪𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙦𝙪𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙚𝙙𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙥𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨𝙨 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙧𝙤𝙡𝙚?
There are a few qualities that can be important for performing effectively in my role. If I had to choose one, I would say the most important quality for a Data Platform Engineer is technical expertise.  
A deep understanding of various data storage and processing technologies is crucial for designing, building, and maintaining a scalable data platform that can effectively support data-driven applications and insights.  
So, it all boils down to your experience.
  
𝘿𝙤 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙛𝙚𝙧 “𝙛𝙡𝙮𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙨𝙤𝙡𝙤 "𝙤𝙧 𝙗𝙚𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙖 𝙥𝙖𝙧𝙩 𝙤𝙛 𝙖 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙢? 𝙒𝙝𝙮?
I would likely prefer to be a part of a team, as collaboration can improve overall results and create a more enjoyable work environment. 
I also appreciate an ability to work independently and take initiative on certain tasks. The right balance is always somewhere in between💡

Every 𝕍𝕒𝕝𝕖𝕟𝕥𝕚𝕟𝕖'𝕤 𝔻𝕒𝕪 presents a great opportunity to show love and appreciation to those around us. This year, instead of focusing on outward expressions of love, we invite you to look inward, and remember that true love starts with 💚YOU💚 

One of Palta’s founding principles is 𝙣𝙪𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚 𝙛𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣 and the ways it can help us reach our goals,  achieve our dreams, and feel empowered. 

Be it your skincare routine (Pora), fitness (Zing Coach™ ), nutrition (Simple App), general well-being (WeatherWell) or even family planning goals (Flo Health Inc.) - Palta’s family of brands is here to help you unlock your best self and share that love with the world 💚

#valentinesday2023 #healthtech #lovefromwithin #leadership

Finding your Tech Tribe is hard 💻 Assembling one can be even harder.
That’s  exactly why we were absolutely thrilled to host a full house, along with a stellar panel of speakers at our last week's event; second in the series 💚 “Building Products with Soul” 💚 

🚗  Did you know that 80% of car rides take less than 2km?
🗓  Or that it takes about 2 months to fully shape a new habit?
⌚  Or that owning a wearable correlates with completing 2 more workouts per week?

These and many other snackable insights were unveiled and exchanged by Ro Huntriss, Mitra Memarzia, Hana Sutch and Egor Stsefanovich with the most engaged audiences we’ve had thus far.

We at Palta thank everyone who visited us at 🌿 Fora Spitalfields🌿 and look forward to seeing you again at our March gathering!

See below, if you are not yet familiar with Palta Health Tech Meetups 👇

✔ 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝗣𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗮 𝗠𝗲𝗲𝘁𝘂𝗽

By attending Palta Meetups, you’ll have an opportunity to learn from leading professionals, to form lasting relationships, and to gain invaluable insights into the tech industry.

✔ 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗜𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗺𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝘆

“𝙄𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙜𝙤 𝙛𝙖𝙨𝙩, 𝙜𝙤 𝙖𝙡𝙤𝙣𝙚, 𝙞𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙜𝙤 𝙛𝙖𝙧, 𝙜𝙤 𝙩𝙤𝙜𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙧”.
Palta firmly stands by these words.
We are a team of individuals who strongly believe in learning from others and growing together as a single industry force. 

✔ 𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝗚𝗲𝘁 𝗜𝗻𝘃𝗼𝗹𝘃𝗲𝗱

We are always looking to make new connections. Watch this space and follow us on 𝙀𝙫𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙗𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙚 to stay informed on future events.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Chief Nutrition Officer at Simple | Palta & Consultant Dietitian
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Bucket list tick off… I’ve written a book! A big thank you to DK and Penguin Random House for the opportunity to author this publication. Bringing together nutrition science and fertility-friendly recipes, I hope this book will be a truly valuable resource for those trying to conceive or for those that wish to in the future. 

Writing a book alongside a full-time job is not easy. My evenings and weekends of 2022 were very saturated at times but it was totally worth it! But a big thanks too to Rhiannon Lambert BSc MSc RNutr , Claire Attwood ANutr and Danielle Mulligan who all played a part in making this book a reality.

It will be released in the UK on 2nd March, and then will be released in the US, Australia and New Zealand, so a bit of a ‘pinch me’ moment!

So keep an eye out online and in book stores. Let’s hope it’s a success and that it helps to create many healthy lives ❤️

If you want a copy you can pre-order now by clicking any of the links below ⬇️

Waterstones: https://lnkd.in/gMD6BDEG 

WHSmith: https://lnkd.in/gSCmHC58

Amazon: https://lnkd.in/gx54bFcZ

#fertility #fertilityjourney #fertilitynutrition #nutrition #dietitian

company_updates_collection.description:
January is here, meaning #bluemonday  - the saddest day of the year- is around the corner. 
This time of year, many people find themselves in freezing temperatures, with very short hours of sun and daylight, all whilst trying to stay motivated and keep up with their New Year’s resolutions. 

WeatherWell app (part of Palta's family of brands) helps users stay in tune with their health and mood shifts by combining world class weather predictions with scientific algorithms and medical expertise.
WeatherWell latest study on Weather Sensitivity explores exactly how the weather may affect your health. 

Check out the full story here: https://lnkd.in/e9TkJmy7

A recent report from 4 Day Week - Global, who conducted a four-day working week trial, revealed an extensive list of wellbeing benefits including:

😓 71% reported lower burnout and 39% lower levels of stress
🤱 21% reported reduction in child care costs 
💼 57% reduction in staff resignations during the trial 

It is now evident that the future of work lies in finding the right balance between flexibility and structure. 

At Palta, we are always looking for ways to provide our employees with the flexibility they need to maintain a healthy work-life balance while still achieving organizational goals. 
Finding that balance can be tricky, but it's an essential part of creating a successful and productive workplace.

Palta’s 🧘♂️ Head of Mindfulness, Walter Gjergja, agrees: 

“We have to start working smart and realize that a greater time allocation to nurturing our wellbeing will most likely lead to a dramatic improvement of both our professional outputs 𝙖𝙣𝙙  personal welfare .

In recent years there has finally been an industry-wide awakening concentrated on shifting away from the so-called “𝙝𝙪𝙨𝙩𝙡𝙚-𝙘𝙪𝙡𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚”. We see businesses striving to understand the many nuances surrounding this complex matter by experimenting with flexible working hours, remote-first work, employee wellbeing programs etc.

In the ⛩ Shaolin Temple ⛩ , where I did part of my studies, we say that  there must be a balance of “𝙬𝙖𝙧𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙧” and "𝙢𝙤𝙣𝙠” . The warrior is the inner 𝙙𝙤𝙚𝙧  and the monk is the inner 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙧; it is only by maintaining a correct harmony of the two that we can achieve mastery and serenity in life ... 
Only 𝙙𝙤𝙞𝙣𝙜 will exhaust our resources, only 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 will not lead to many accomplishments.”

#wellbeing #futureofwork #workinghours #flexibleworking #remotejobs

company_updates_collection.description:
Meet Dmitry Lyubimov 👋  
He started his journey at Palta only few months ago, after coming across a job ad on LinkedIn. Loved the mission, got inspired by the international growth of the company and 💥 boom - the next thing we know he's with us 🧩  

Mitya joined us as a Data Platform Developer at Palta 🧠 Brain - a customized data, analytics, monetization, and payments platform that helps all our products thrive. 

Read on to learn more about Mitya 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories. 

𝘾𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙂𝙋𝙏- 𝙩𝙮𝙥𝙚 𝙦𝙪𝙚𝙨𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣: 𝙋𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙨𝙚 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙡𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖 𝘽𝙧𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙤 𝙢𝙚, 𝙖𝙨 𝙞𝙛 𝙄 𝙖𝙢 𝙖 5 𝙮𝙚𝙖𝙧 𝙤𝙡𝙙.
Okay, imagine you have loads of toys, like different LEGO bricks. And now imagine that for some reason you want to keep all your bricks organized (doesn’t ever happen to your average 5 y.o. 🤷♂️ ) so that you can find them easily when you want to play.  
A data platform is kind of like that large drawer that helps you keep all your information organized and quick to find: all your LEGOs neatly stacked and sorted, brilliant, isn’t it? 
We can also think of Palta Brain as an assistant. It helps startups divide their customers into smaller groups, so that they can approach each group in a unique way.  
To illustrate this, let's pretend you have a bag of sweets, and you wish to share them with your friends (again, why on Earth would you? 🤷♂️ ). You might, however, decide to give your best friend and your cousin different sweets. The same way startups can use Palta Brain to send different messages to different groups of customers. 
 
𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙫𝙞𝙚𝙬 𝙞𝙨 “𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙭𝙩 𝙗𝙞𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜” 𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙚𝙘𝙝?
AI will continue to play an increasingly important role in many industries and aspects of society. If we talk about HealthTech, AI is expected to play a major role in improving the accuracy of diagnoses and medical treatments, streamlining the drug discovery process, and enabling a more personalized approach. 

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙖 𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙡𝙚 𝙘𝙧𝙪𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙦𝙪𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙚𝙙𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙥𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨𝙨 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙧𝙤𝙡𝙚?
There are a few qualities that can be important for performing effectively in my role. If I had to choose one, I would say the most important quality for a Data Platform Engineer is technical expertise.  
A deep understanding of various data storage and processing technologies is crucial for designing, building, and maintaining a scalable data platform that can effectively support data-driven applications and insights.  
So, it all boils down to your experience.
  
𝘿𝙤 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙛𝙚𝙧 “𝙛𝙡𝙮𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙨𝙤𝙡𝙤 "𝙤𝙧 𝙗𝙚𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙖 𝙥𝙖𝙧𝙩 𝙤𝙛 𝙖 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙢? 𝙒𝙝𝙮?
I would likely prefer to be a part of a team, as collaboration can improve overall results and create a more enjoyable work environment. 
I also appreciate an ability to work independently and take initiative on certain tasks. The right balance is always somewhere in between💡

Every 𝕍𝕒𝕝𝕖𝕟𝕥𝕚𝕟𝕖'𝕤 𝔻𝕒𝕪 presents a great opportunity to show love and appreciation to those around us. This year, instead of focusing on outward expressions of love, we invite you to look inward, and remember that true love starts with 💚YOU💚 

One of Palta’s founding principles is 𝙣𝙪𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚 𝙛𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣 and the ways it can help us reach our goals,  achieve our dreams, and feel empowered. 

Be it your skincare routine (Pora), fitness (Zing Coach™ ), nutrition (Simple App), general well-being (WeatherWell) or even family planning goals (Flo Health Inc.) - Palta’s family of brands is here to help you unlock your best self and share that love with the world 💚

Finding your Tech Tribe is hard 💻 Assembling one can be even harder.
That’s  exactly why we were absolutely thrilled to host a full house, along with a stellar panel of speakers at our last week's event; second in the series 💚 “Building Products with Soul” 💚

“𝙄𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙜𝙤 𝙛𝙖𝙨𝙩, 𝙜𝙤 𝙖𝙡𝙤𝙣𝙚, 𝙞𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙜𝙤 𝙛𝙖𝙧, 𝙜𝙤 𝙩𝙤𝙜𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙧”.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Bucket list tick off… I’ve written a book! A big thank you to DK and Penguin Random House for the opportunity to author this publication. Bringing together nutrition science and fertility-friendly recipes, I hope this book will be a truly valuable resource for those trying to conceive or for those that wish to in the future. 

Writing a book alongside a full-time job is not easy. My evenings and weekends of 2022 were very saturated at times but it was totally worth it! But a big thanks too to Rhiannon Lambert BSc MSc RNutr , Claire Attwood ANutr and Danielle Mulligan who all played a part in making this book a reality.

It will be released in the UK on 2nd March, and then will be released in the US, Australia and New Zealand, so a bit of a ‘pinch me’ moment!

So keep an eye out online and in book stores. Let’s hope it’s a success and that it helps to create many healthy lives ❤️

Meet Stuart Murray 👋 
Palta's Chief Information Security Officer (or simply, CISO). If you ever google the term CISO, the very first question you'd see cropping up in search is 🧩 "𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗖𝗜𝗦𝗢 𝗱𝗼?" 🧩  
Quite a lot! In a nutshell, Stuart is responsible for the overall security of Palta's information systems. 
Read on to learn more 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝘿𝙤 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧 𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙖𝙢𝙚 𝙥𝙖𝙨𝙨𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙙 𝙩𝙬𝙞𝙘𝙚?
Hardly ever, but there are some edge cases where I will do it - for example, if it’s a password I have to remember and can’t use a password manager for it. 
Logging into Netflix on a TV when you have a 24 character password is a user experience nightmare!
For important stuff like banking I never use the same password twice.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙗𝙚𝙩𝙬𝙚𝙚𝙣 𝙧𝙪𝙣𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙄𝙣𝙛𝙤𝙧𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙎𝙚𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙞𝙣 𝙡𝙖𝙧𝙜𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙧𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝘽𝙋 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙈𝙞𝙘𝙧𝙤𝙨𝙤𝙛𝙩 𝙫𝙨 𝙞𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙥𝙚𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙗𝙪𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖?
Availability of resources. 
Small companies are often in survival mode, where the impact of decisions on how you invest the limited resources you have are magnified. I always say that in a small business you have to be comfortable with what you’re NOT DOING. In a large enterprise with 200 people doing security, you can just DO IT ALL. 
That’s not to say that security in a large company is easy, because it really isn’t - it’s just a different focus and way of operating.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙖 𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙡𝙚 𝙘𝙧𝙪𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙦𝙪𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙚𝙙𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙥𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨𝙨 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙧𝙤𝙡𝙚?
Pragmatism. 
You can learn all you want about the best way to secure things, but eventually that bumps up against the real world of what the business needs, so you need to know how to get to “secure enough”. 

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙫𝙞𝙚𝙬𝙨 𝙤𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙤𝙛 𝙥𝙡𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙮𝙗𝙚𝙧 𝙨𝙚𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙨𝙥𝙖𝙘𝙚/𝙗𝙪𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙚𝙨𝙨?
The state of play is that there isn’t really a state of play! 
There’s a very high rate of change and the trend of increasingly sophisticated threats isn’t going away. A large number of people underestimate the impact that cyber attacks can have, meaning that we still see underinvestment, and data breaches happening due to basic controls not being implemented properly. 
Security vendors have all sorts of magical solutions to all sorts of terrible possibilities, but right now many companies are still at the stage where they just need to focus on excellent execution of the basics.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙢𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙞𝙢𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪’𝙙 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙚𝙫𝙚 𝙙𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖?
If I can leave Palta with an Information Security Programme that is ready to adapt to the challenges ahead, then I’ll be happy.

#data #cisolife #healthtech #cybersecurity #ciso

Ice baths, frequent exposure to cold and post-workout freezing cold showers have recently become a staple amongst biohacking and lifestyle influencers 📈
A new 𝗵𝗼𝗹𝘆 𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗶𝗹 or another social media 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵 𝗳𝗮𝗱 ? 
Palta's 💚 Chief Medical Advisor, Dr. Andrew Belaveshkin MD PhD shares his views:

"It’s true - many believe that ice baths help to recover, lose weight, strengthen physical and mental health, improve blood flow, and even libido. Is that so?

So far, science has refuted all of these statements:

🛁  Ice baths 𝗱𝗼 𝗻𝗼𝘁 speed up recovery

💪 They noticeably 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝘀𝗲𝗻 muscle growth after training, reducing the rate  by 25% 

😱 𝗡𝗼 positive effect of baths on anxiety reduction was found

🐭 Ice baths 𝗼𝗻𝗹𝘆 help mice to lose weight, 𝗻𝗼𝘁 people

𝗪𝗵𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗴𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗹𝗹𝘂𝘀𝗼𝗿𝘆, 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹. 
The main organ at risk is the heart. Multiple studies show that the level of 𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝗻𝗶𝗻 - a marker of heart muscle damage, is increased in the blood of people who take ice baths.

Exposure to cold sparks the release of adrenaline, and it accelerates the pulse, while diving or immersing activates the diver’s reflex, which slows down the pulse. Working in a juxtaposition both processes create a tremendous toll on the heart, encouraging arrhythmia, and in the worst case scenario, leading up to a cardiac arrest. 

𝗦𝗼 𝘄𝗵𝘆 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗵𝘀 𝘀𝗼 𝗽𝗼𝗽𝘂𝗹𝗮𝗿? 
As a consequence one experiences a release of adrenaline and endorphins, and these invigorates us. Humans in general tend to lead towards extremes; it seems to us that the more we push the boundaries, the more useful it is. Alas, when it comes to health, the “golden mean” principle is most often the best approach. 
Of course you  can feel like a hero just lying in your bath, BUT narcissism kills and humbleness cures.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗴𝘂𝗹𝗮𝗿 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗼𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗰𝗼𝗹𝗱?
It’s helpful, when done in moderation. Instead of ice baths, you can take air baths, as Benjamin Franklin did. Daily cold showers and sleeping in a cool bedroom would also do you good.
For example, a 30 second cold shower 𝗿𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗸 of catching a cold by 29% .

Scientists have proven that it is beneficial to sleep in a cool bedroom, as this increases your amount of useful brown fat, improves insulin sensitivity, and helps burn calories. 
Even coolness at 19C is quite effective in 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝘆 of brown fat by 30–40%.

One might not land any Instagram-worthy content by engaging in these activities, but it is much safer, and better for your health and environment 💚 

#growth  #science #healthandwellbeing #awareness #trend #mentalhealth #biohacking #icebath #wimhof

A recent report from 4 Day Week - Global, who conducted a four-day working week trial, revealed an extensive list of wellbeing benefits including:

😓 71% reported lower burnout and 39% lower levels of stress
🤱 21% reported reduction in child care costs 
💼 57% reduction in staff resignations during the trial 

It is now evident that the future of work lies in finding the right balance between flexibility and structure. 

At Palta, we are always looking for ways to provide our employees with the flexibility they need to maintain a healthy work-life balance while still achieving organizational goals. 
Finding that balance can be tricky, but it's an essential part of creating a successful and productive workplace.

Palta’s 🧘♂️ Head of Mindfulness, Walter Gjergja, agrees: 

“We have to start working smart and realize that a greater time allocation to nurturing our wellbeing will most likely lead to a dramatic improvement of both our professional outputs 𝙖𝙣𝙙  personal welfare .

In recent years there has finally been an industry-wide awakening concentrated on shifting away from the so-called “𝙝𝙪𝙨𝙩𝙡𝙚-𝙘𝙪𝙡𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚”. We see businesses striving to understand the many nuances surrounding this complex matter by experimenting with flexible working hours, remote-first work, employee wellbeing programs etc.

In the ⛩ Shaolin Temple ⛩ , where I did part of my studies, we say that  there must be a balance of “𝙬𝙖𝙧𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙧” and "𝙢𝙤𝙣𝙠” . The warrior is the inner 𝙙𝙤𝙚𝙧  and the monk is the inner 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙧; it is only by maintaining a correct harmony of the two that we can achieve mastery and serenity in life ... 
Only 𝙙𝙤𝙞𝙣𝙜 will exhaust our resources, only 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 will not lead to many accomplishments.”

#wellbeing #futureofwork #workinghours #flexibleworking #remotejobs

Big Tech layoffs have claimed more than 💼  150,000 jobs in recent months. According to experts at 365 Data Science - only 10 percent of those laid off have thus far listed a new job on their LinkedIn profiles. If you or someone you know are among the "𝙤𝙥𝙚𝙣 𝙩𝙤 𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠" majority, then keep on reading.

Meet Dmitry Lyubimov 👋  
He started his journey at Palta only few months ago, after coming across a job ad on LinkedIn. Loved the mission, got inspired by the international growth of the company and 💥 boom - the next thing we know he's with us 🧩  

Mitya joined us as a Data Platform Developer at Palta 🧠 Brain - a customized data, analytics, monetization, and payments platform that helps all our products thrive. 

Read on to learn more about Mitya 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories. 

𝘾𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙂𝙋𝙏- 𝙩𝙮𝙥𝙚 𝙦𝙪𝙚𝙨𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣: 𝙋𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙨𝙚 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙡𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖 𝘽𝙧𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙤 𝙢𝙚, 𝙖𝙨 𝙞𝙛 𝙄 𝙖𝙢 𝙖 5 𝙮𝙚𝙖𝙧 𝙤𝙡𝙙.
Okay, imagine you have loads of toys, like different LEGO bricks. And now imagine that for some reason you want to keep all your bricks organized (doesn’t ever happen to your average 5 y.o. 🤷♂️ ) so that you can find them easily when you want to play.  
A data platform is kind of like that large drawer that helps you keep all your information organized and quick to find: all your LEGOs neatly stacked and sorted, brilliant, isn’t it? 
We can also think of Palta Brain as an assistant. It helps startups divide their customers into smaller groups, so that they can approach each group in a unique way.  
To illustrate this, let's pretend you have a bag of sweets, and you wish to share them with your friends (again, why on Earth would you? 🤷♂️ ). You might, however, decide to give your best friend and your cousin different sweets. The same way startups can use Palta Brain to send different messages to different groups of customers. 
 
𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙫𝙞𝙚𝙬 𝙞𝙨 “𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙭𝙩 𝙗𝙞𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜” 𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙚𝙘𝙝?
AI will continue to play an increasingly important role in many industries and aspects of society. If we talk about HealthTech, AI is expected to play a major role in improving the accuracy of diagnoses and medical treatments, streamlining the drug discovery process, and enabling a more personalized approach. 

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙖 𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙡𝙚 𝙘𝙧𝙪𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙦𝙪𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙚𝙙𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙥𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨𝙨 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙧𝙤𝙡𝙚?
There are a few qualities that can be important for performing effectively in my role. If I had to choose one, I would say the most important quality for a Data Platform Engineer is technical expertise.  
A deep understanding of various data storage and processing technologies is crucial for designing, building, and maintaining a scalable data platform that can effectively support data-driven applications and insights.  
So, it all boils down to your experience.
  
𝘿𝙤 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙛𝙚𝙧 “𝙛𝙡𝙮𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙨𝙤𝙡𝙤 "𝙤𝙧 𝙗𝙚𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙖 𝙥𝙖𝙧𝙩 𝙤𝙛 𝙖 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙢? 𝙒𝙝𝙮?
I would likely prefer to be a part of a team, as collaboration can improve overall results and create a more enjoyable work environment. 
I also appreciate an ability to work independently and take initiative on certain tasks. The right balance is always somewhere in between💡

Every 𝕍𝕒𝕝𝕖𝕟𝕥𝕚𝕟𝕖'𝕤 𝔻𝕒𝕪 presents a great opportunity to show love and appreciation to those around us. This year, instead of focusing on outward expressions of love, we invite you to look inward, and remember that true love starts with 💚YOU💚 

One of Palta’s founding principles is 𝙣𝙪𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚 𝙛𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣 and the ways it can help us reach our goals,  achieve our dreams, and feel empowered. 

Be it your skincare routine (Pora), fitness (Zing Coach™ ), nutrition (Simple App), general well-being (WeatherWell) or even family planning goals (Flo Health Inc.) - Palta’s family of brands is here to help you unlock your best self and share that love with the world 💚

Finding your Tech Tribe is hard 💻 Assembling one can be even harder.

“𝙄𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙜𝙤 𝙛𝙖𝙨𝙩, 𝙜𝙤 𝙖𝙡𝙤𝙣𝙚, 𝙞𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙜𝙤 𝙛𝙖𝙧, 𝙜𝙤 𝙩𝙤𝙜𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙧”.

Meet Stuart Murray 👋 
Palta's Chief Information Security Officer (or simply, CISO). If you ever google the term CISO, the very first question you'd see cropping up in search is 🧩 "𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗖𝗜𝗦𝗢 𝗱𝗼?" 🧩  
Quite a lot! In a nutshell, Stuart is responsible for the overall security of Palta's information systems. 
Read on to learn more 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝘿𝙤 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧 𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙖𝙢𝙚 𝙥𝙖𝙨𝙨𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙙 𝙩𝙬𝙞𝙘𝙚?
Hardly ever, but there are some edge cases where I will do it - for example, if it’s a password I have to remember and can’t use a password manager for it. 
Logging into Netflix on a TV when you have a 24 character password is a user experience nightmare!
For important stuff like banking I never use the same password twice.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙗𝙚𝙩𝙬𝙚𝙚𝙣 𝙧𝙪𝙣𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙄𝙣𝙛𝙤𝙧𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙎𝙚𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙞𝙣 𝙡𝙖𝙧𝙜𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙧𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝘽𝙋 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙈𝙞𝙘𝙧𝙤𝙨𝙤𝙛𝙩 𝙫𝙨 𝙞𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙥𝙚𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙗𝙪𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖?
Availability of resources. 
Small companies are often in survival mode, where the impact of decisions on how you invest the limited resources you have are magnified. I always say that in a small business you have to be comfortable with what you’re NOT DOING. In a large enterprise with 200 people doing security, you can just DO IT ALL. 
That’s not to say that security in a large company is easy, because it really isn’t - it’s just a different focus and way of operating.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙖 𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙡𝙚 𝙘𝙧𝙪𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙦𝙪𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙚𝙙𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙥𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨𝙨 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙧𝙤𝙡𝙚?
Pragmatism. 
You can learn all you want about the best way to secure things, but eventually that bumps up against the real world of what the business needs, so you need to know how to get to “secure enough”. 

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙫𝙞𝙚𝙬𝙨 𝙤𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙤𝙛 𝙥𝙡𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙮𝙗𝙚𝙧 𝙨𝙚𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙨𝙥𝙖𝙘𝙚/𝙗𝙪𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙚𝙨𝙨?
The state of play is that there isn’t really a state of play! 
There’s a very high rate of change and the trend of increasingly sophisticated threats isn’t going away. A large number of people underestimate the impact that cyber attacks can have, meaning that we still see underinvestment, and data breaches happening due to basic controls not being implemented properly. 
Security vendors have all sorts of magical solutions to all sorts of terrible possibilities, but right now many companies are still at the stage where they just need to focus on excellent execution of the basics.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙢𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙞𝙢𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪’𝙙 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙚𝙫𝙚 𝙙𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖?
If I can leave Palta with an Information Security Programme that is ready to adapt to the challenges ahead, then I’ll be happy.

#data #cisolife #healthtech #cybersecurity #ciso

Ice baths, frequent exposure to cold and post-workout freezing cold showers have recently become a staple amongst biohacking and lifestyle influencers 📈
A new 𝗵𝗼𝗹𝘆 𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗶𝗹 or another social media 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵 𝗳𝗮𝗱 ? 
Palta's 💚 Chief Medical Advisor, Dr. Andrew Belaveshkin MD PhD shares his views:

"It’s true - many believe that ice baths help to recover, lose weight, strengthen physical and mental health, improve blood flow, and even libido. Is that so?

So far, science has refuted all of these statements:

🛁  Ice baths 𝗱𝗼 𝗻𝗼𝘁 speed up recovery

💪 They noticeably 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝘀𝗲𝗻 muscle growth after training, reducing the rate  by 25% 

😱 𝗡𝗼 positive effect of baths on anxiety reduction was found

🐭 Ice baths 𝗼𝗻𝗹𝘆 help mice to lose weight, 𝗻𝗼𝘁 people

𝗪𝗵𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗴𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗹𝗹𝘂𝘀𝗼𝗿𝘆, 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹. 
The main organ at risk is the heart. Multiple studies show that the level of 𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝗻𝗶𝗻 - a marker of heart muscle damage, is increased in the blood of people who take ice baths.

Exposure to cold sparks the release of adrenaline, and it accelerates the pulse, while diving or immersing activates the diver’s reflex, which slows down the pulse. Working in a juxtaposition both processes create a tremendous toll on the heart, encouraging arrhythmia, and in the worst case scenario, leading up to a cardiac arrest. 

𝗦𝗼 𝘄𝗵𝘆 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗵𝘀 𝘀𝗼 𝗽𝗼𝗽𝘂𝗹𝗮𝗿? 
As a consequence one experiences a release of adrenaline and endorphins, and these invigorates us. Humans in general tend to lead towards extremes; it seems to us that the more we push the boundaries, the more useful it is. Alas, when it comes to health, the “golden mean” principle is most often the best approach. 
Of course you  can feel like a hero just lying in your bath, BUT narcissism kills and humbleness cures.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗴𝘂𝗹𝗮𝗿 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗼𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗰𝗼𝗹𝗱?
It’s helpful, when done in moderation. Instead of ice baths, you can take air baths, as Benjamin Franklin did. Daily cold showers and sleeping in a cool bedroom would also do you good.
For example, a 30 second cold shower 𝗿𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗸 of catching a cold by 29% .

Scientists have proven that it is beneficial to sleep in a cool bedroom, as this increases your amount of useful brown fat, improves insulin sensitivity, and helps burn calories. 
Even coolness at 19C is quite effective in 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝘆 of brown fat by 30–40%.

One might not land any Instagram-worthy content by engaging in these activities, but it is much safer, and better for your health and environment 💚 

#growth  #science #healthandwellbeing #awareness #trend #mentalhealth #biohacking #icebath #wimhof

A recent report from 4 Day Week - Global, who conducted a four-day working week trial, revealed an extensive list of wellbeing benefits including:

😓 71% reported lower burnout and 39% lower levels of stress
🤱 21% reported reduction in child care costs 
💼 57% reduction in staff resignations during the trial 

It is now evident that the future of work lies in finding the right balance between flexibility and structure. 

At Palta, we are always looking for ways to provide our employees with the flexibility they need to maintain a healthy work-life balance while still achieving organizational goals. 
Finding that balance can be tricky, but it's an essential part of creating a successful and productive workplace.

Palta’s 🧘♂️ Head of Mindfulness, Walter Gjergja, agrees: 

“We have to start working smart and realize that a greater time allocation to nurturing our wellbeing will most likely lead to a dramatic improvement of both our professional outputs 𝙖𝙣𝙙  personal welfare .

In recent years there has finally been an industry-wide awakening concentrated on shifting away from the so-called “𝙝𝙪𝙨𝙩𝙡𝙚-𝙘𝙪𝙡𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚”. We see businesses striving to understand the many nuances surrounding this complex matter by experimenting with flexible working hours, remote-first work, employee wellbeing programs etc.

In the ⛩ Shaolin Temple ⛩ , where I did part of my studies, we say that  there must be a balance of “𝙬𝙖𝙧𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙧” and "𝙢𝙤𝙣𝙠” . The warrior is the inner 𝙙𝙤𝙚𝙧  and the monk is the inner 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙧; it is only by maintaining a correct harmony of the two that we can achieve mastery and serenity in life ... 
Only 𝙙𝙤𝙞𝙣𝙜 will exhaust our resources, only 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 will not lead to many accomplishments.”

#wellbeing #futureofwork #workinghours #flexibleworking #remotejobs

Big Tech layoffs have claimed more than 💼  150,000 jobs in recent months. According to experts at 365 Data Science - only 10 percent of those laid off have thus far listed a new job on their LinkedIn profiles. If you or someone you know are among the "𝙤𝙥𝙚𝙣 𝙩𝙤 𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠" majority, then keep on reading.

Palta 💚 offers flexibility of remote-first roles combined with a unique opportunity to become part of truly innovative, AI-driven start-ups within our family of brands. 
Here is a recent example👇 click below to check out a few Product roles with Pora - our Beauty and Health AI  assistant developed to democratize dermatology and cosmetology services.

Meet Dmitry Lyubimov 👋  
He started his journey at Palta only few months ago, after coming across a job ad on LinkedIn. Loved the mission, got inspired by the international growth of the company and 💥 boom - the next thing we know he's with us 🧩  

Mitya joined us as a Data Platform Developer at Palta 🧠 Brain - a customized data, analytics, monetization, and payments platform that helps all our products thrive. 

Read on to learn more about Mitya 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories. 

𝘾𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙂𝙋𝙏- 𝙩𝙮𝙥𝙚 𝙦𝙪𝙚𝙨𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣: 𝙋𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙨𝙚 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙡𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖 𝘽𝙧𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙤 𝙢𝙚, 𝙖𝙨 𝙞𝙛 𝙄 𝙖𝙢 𝙖 5 𝙮𝙚𝙖𝙧 𝙤𝙡𝙙.
Okay, imagine you have loads of toys, like different LEGO bricks. And now imagine that for some reason you want to keep all your bricks organized (doesn’t ever happen to your average 5 y.o. 🤷♂️ ) so that you can find them easily when you want to play.  
A data platform is kind of like that large drawer that helps you keep all your information organized and quick to find: all your LEGOs neatly stacked and sorted, brilliant, isn’t it? 
We can also think of Palta Brain as an assistant. It helps startups divide their customers into smaller groups, so that they can approach each group in a unique way.  
To illustrate this, let's pretend you have a bag of sweets, and you wish to share them with your friends (again, why on Earth would you? 🤷♂️ ). You might, however, decide to give your best friend and your cousin different sweets. The same way startups can use Palta Brain to send different messages to different groups of customers. 
 
𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙫𝙞𝙚𝙬 𝙞𝙨 “𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙭𝙩 𝙗𝙞𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜” 𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙚𝙘𝙝?
AI will continue to play an increasingly important role in many industries and aspects of society. If we talk about HealthTech, AI is expected to play a major role in improving the accuracy of diagnoses and medical treatments, streamlining the drug discovery process, and enabling a more personalized approach. 

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙖 𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙡𝙚 𝙘𝙧𝙪𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙦𝙪𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙚𝙙𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙥𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨𝙨 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙧𝙤𝙡𝙚?
There are a few qualities that can be important for performing effectively in my role. If I had to choose one, I would say the most important quality for a Data Platform Engineer is technical expertise.  
A deep understanding of various data storage and processing technologies is crucial for designing, building, and maintaining a scalable data platform that can effectively support data-driven applications and insights.  
So, it all boils down to your experience.
  
𝘿𝙤 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙥𝙧𝙚𝙛𝙚𝙧 “𝙛𝙡𝙮𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙨𝙤𝙡𝙤 "𝙤𝙧 𝙗𝙚𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙖 𝙥𝙖𝙧𝙩 𝙤𝙛 𝙖 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙢? 𝙒𝙝𝙮?
I would likely prefer to be a part of a team, as collaboration can improve overall results and create a more enjoyable work environment. 
I also appreciate an ability to work independently and take initiative on certain tasks. The right balance is always somewhere in between💡

Every 𝕍𝕒𝕝𝕖𝕟𝕥𝕚𝕟𝕖'𝕤 𝔻𝕒𝕪 presents a great opportunity to show love and appreciation to those around us. This year, instead of focusing on outward expressions of love, we invite you to look inward, and remember that true love starts with 💚YOU💚 

One of Palta’s founding principles is 𝙣𝙪𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙡𝙤𝙫𝙚 𝙛𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣 and the ways it can help us reach our goals,  achieve our dreams, and feel empowered. 

Be it your skincare routine (Pora), fitness (Zing Coach™ ), nutrition (Simple App), general well-being (WeatherWell) or even family planning goals (Flo Health Inc.) - Palta’s family of brands is here to help you unlock your best self and share that love with the world 💚

#valentinesday2023 #healthtech #lovefromwithin #leadership

Finding your Tech Tribe is hard 💻 Assembling one can be even harder.
That’s  exactly why we were absolutely thrilled to host a full house, along with a stellar panel of speakers at our last week's event; second in the series 💚 “Building Products with Soul” 💚 

🚗  Did you know that 80% of car rides take less than 2km?
🗓  Or that it takes about 2 months to fully shape a new habit?

“𝙄𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙜𝙤 𝙛𝙖𝙨𝙩, 𝙜𝙤 𝙖𝙡𝙤𝙣𝙚, 𝙞𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙜𝙤 𝙛𝙖𝙧, 𝙜𝙤 𝙩𝙤𝙜𝙚𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙧”.

Meet Victor Stepanov 👋 
Victor heads 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 at one of Palta's most exciting products - Pora (a beauty and Health AI assistant developed to democratize dermatology and cosmetology services). 

Read on to learn more 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝗮 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗳𝗼𝗰𝘂𝘀 𝗮𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝗮?
It’s so exciting to work on a digital product that aims to change physical experience. 
For me, that’s the most rewarding part — to work on content that goes beyond digital. My focus at Pora is to make sure we build lean and scalable content production flow.

𝗜𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗹𝗱 𝗼𝗳 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗹𝘂𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗿𝘀, 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿-𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗼𝗺𝘆 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗱 𝘀𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗶𝘀 𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗞𝗶𝗻𝗴?
I think Brand Content should evolve to stay relevant. It should bring value, become personalised and contextual. Brand Content has the power to connect audiences with meaningful insights and science-backed information about their health and wellness at a scale that is hard to beat if you’re an influencer or an independent creator.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝗾𝘂𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗲?
Constantly learn to do less to achieve more vs doing more to achieve less.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝗮?
Change people’s habits when it comes to choosing, buying and using cosmetics.

𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗿 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗽𝗮𝘀𝘁-𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳?
Learn to code 👨💻 

𝗕𝗼𝗻𝘂𝘀 𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻  𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗺𝗮𝗻𝘆 𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗽𝘀 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗿𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗹𝘂𝗱𝗲?
Typically, three. Cleansing, toning and moisturising. 
Gotta do your basics 😎

We couldn’t have summarised it better 💚#healthtech #productdesign #ai #londonevents

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
☘️ What does it mean to build products with 𝘴𝘰𝘶𝘭 ? [healthtech edition]

Another wonderful event hosted by Palta and learnt from inspiring speakers Thuria Wenbar, Konstantin Yakovlev, Kai Koch, Patrick Fagan and Dr. Ashish Patel, MD discussing the importance of building healthtech products with empathy.  

Some key takeaways:
🤖 Machine learning models give predictions, but a human makes the ultimate decision
🤖 Emotional intelligence (eg. chatbots) providing timely and relevant information with engagement retention
🧠 Mitigating risks and maximising benefits to patients with generative AI
🧠 Providing value at scale from digital to non-digital solutions by avoiding jargon and using human language

Building products is intuitive, but building products with empathy and soul makes non-human solutions humane. It connects with patients/ users more personally and empowers them on a meaningful level. 

𝘚𝘰𝘶𝘭 excited to see what the future holds! (sorry bad pun..)😮💨

#healthtech #healthcare #digitalhealth #ai #startup

Meet Magdalena B. 👋 
Palta's HR Operations Manager. Magda joined the team back in January and is currently based at Palta's office in the beautiful city of Warsaw.

Read on to learn more 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝗜𝘀 𝗶𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗳𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗧𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵? 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘆?
It is indeed. Healthy lifestyle is so important to me, that I should say, it’s been a major reason for me deciding to join Palta 💚 

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗽𝗶𝗲𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗼𝘂𝗹𝗱 𝗴𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗻𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝘄𝗵𝗼’𝘀 𝗹𝗼𝗼𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗼 𝗷𝗼𝗶𝗻 𝗣𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗮?
Palta provides a great amount of opportunities for personal growth and professional development. It massively supports young talent, so it is the perfect place for people who want to spread their wings.
I would like to quote Eminem here...: “𝙔𝙤𝙪 𝙤𝙣𝙡𝙮 𝙜𝙚𝙩 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙨𝙝𝙤𝙩, 𝙙𝙤 𝙣𝙤𝙩 𝙢𝙞𝙨𝙨 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙗𝙡𝙤𝙬. 𝙏𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙨 𝙤𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙞𝙣 𝙖 𝙡𝙞𝙛𝙚𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚” 😉 

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗣𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗮?

🚰 Water is the most valuable life component on Earth, second only to air. While we cannot really forget to breathe, we do tend to ignore our daily need for staying hydrated. This #WorldWaterDay Andrew Belaveshkin MD PhD Palta's 💚 Medical Advisor offers three simple tactics for staying on the top of your game:

𝗔𝗱𝗷𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗪𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗕𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲
Always keep your water bottle handy, and if you do at any point feel or think that you might be thirsty just take a sip and see if this sensation enhances. If it does, then you do indeed need to replenish your biofluids reserves. 
This simple method of sample siping is highly effective and quick to adapt.

𝗘𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗪𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗕𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲
Dehydration manifests itself via multiple 🚩 red flags 🚩  - dry skin sensation, itchy eyes, dry mouth, muscle weakness, you name it! However the most accurate indicator is…the shade of urine. You may often not fully realize how thirsty you really are until you visit the bathroom (refer to the chart 👇).
For example, if you find yourself under a considerable amount of stress, the sensation of being thirsty can get dulled and go unnoticed for hours.This will immediately reflect in the color of a urine sample (unless you take certain daily vitamins and supplements). It’s key to mention that thirst disappears before your water deficiency gets fully compensated, so it is important to have access to water within the next 15-20 min after quenching your thirst.

𝗖𝗵𝗼𝗼𝘀𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗕𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗛𝘆𝗱𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗱
Herbal teas with fresh mint or lemon can also suffice. Some green tea, cacao, or even a couple cups of coffee ( ☕ ☕ not more) should do the trick.
Please remember that juices, milk and even plant based milk are poor sources of hydration. Sugary drinks will simply make you more thirsty.  So what is the best drink? Just water!

#healthtech #worldwaterday2023 #hydration #health

Meet Stuart Murray 👋 
Palta's Chief Information Security Officer (or simply, CISO). If you ever google the term CISO, the very first question you'd see cropping up in search is 🧩 "𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗖𝗜𝗦𝗢 𝗱𝗼?" 🧩  
Quite a lot! In a nutshell, Stuart is responsible for the overall security of Palta's information systems. 
Read on to learn more 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝘿𝙤 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧 𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙖𝙢𝙚 𝙥𝙖𝙨𝙨𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙙 𝙩𝙬𝙞𝙘𝙚?
Hardly ever, but there are some edge cases where I will do it - for example, if it’s a password I have to remember and can’t use a password manager for it. 
Logging into Netflix on a TV when you have a 24 character password is a user experience nightmare!
For important stuff like banking I never use the same password twice.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙧𝙚 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙗𝙚𝙩𝙬𝙚𝙚𝙣 𝙧𝙪𝙣𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙄𝙣𝙛𝙤𝙧𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙎𝙚𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙞𝙣 𝙡𝙖𝙧𝙜𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙧𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝘽𝙋 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙈𝙞𝙘𝙧𝙤𝙨𝙤𝙛𝙩 𝙫𝙨 𝙞𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙥𝙚𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙗𝙪𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖?
Availability of resources. 
Small companies are often in survival mode, where the impact of decisions on how you invest the limited resources you have are magnified. I always say that in a small business you have to be comfortable with what you’re NOT DOING. In a large enterprise with 200 people doing security, you can just DO IT ALL. 
That’s not to say that security in a large company is easy, because it really isn’t - it’s just a different focus and way of operating.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙖 𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙡𝙚 𝙘𝙧𝙪𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡 𝙦𝙪𝙖𝙡𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙣𝙚𝙚𝙙𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙥𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙚𝙨𝙨 𝙞𝙣 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙧𝙤𝙡𝙚?
Pragmatism. 
You can learn all you want about the best way to secure things, but eventually that bumps up against the real world of what the business needs, so you need to know how to get to “secure enough”. 

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙫𝙞𝙚𝙬𝙨 𝙤𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙤𝙛 𝙥𝙡𝙖𝙮 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙮𝙗𝙚𝙧 𝙨𝙚𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙨𝙥𝙖𝙘𝙚/𝙗𝙪𝙨𝙞𝙣𝙚𝙨𝙨?
The state of play is that there isn’t really a state of play! 
There’s a very high rate of change and the trend of increasingly sophisticated threats isn’t going away. A large number of people underestimate the impact that cyber attacks can have, meaning that we still see underinvestment, and data breaches happening due to basic controls not being implemented properly. 
Security vendors have all sorts of magical solutions to all sorts of terrible possibilities, but right now many companies are still at the stage where they just need to focus on excellent execution of the basics.

𝙒𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙨 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙢𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙞𝙢𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪’𝙙 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙖𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙚𝙫𝙚 𝙙𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙋𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙖?
If I can leave Palta with an Information Security Programme that is ready to adapt to the challenges ahead, then I’ll be happy.

#data #cisolife #healthtech #cybersecurity #ciso

Meet Victor Stepanov 👋 
Victor heads 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 at one of Palta's most exciting products - Pora (a beauty and Health AI assistant developed to democratize dermatology and cosmetology services). 

Read on to learn more 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝗮 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗳𝗼𝗰𝘂𝘀 𝗮𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝗮?
It’s so exciting to work on a digital product that aims to change physical experience. 
For me, that’s the most rewarding part — to work on content that goes beyond digital. My focus at Pora is to make sure we build lean and scalable content production flow.

𝗜𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗹𝗱 𝗼𝗳 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗹𝘂𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗿𝘀, 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿-𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗼𝗺𝘆 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗱 𝘀𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗶𝘀 𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗞𝗶𝗻𝗴?
I think Brand Content should evolve to stay relevant. It should bring value, become personalised and contextual. Brand Content has the power to connect audiences with meaningful insights and science-backed information about their health and wellness at a scale that is hard to beat if you’re an influencer or an independent creator.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝗾𝘂𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗲?
Constantly learn to do less to achieve more vs doing more to achieve less.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝗮?
Change people’s habits when it comes to choosing, buying and using cosmetics.

𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗿 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗽𝗮𝘀𝘁-𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳?
Learn to code 👨💻 

𝗕𝗼𝗻𝘂𝘀 𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻  𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗺𝗮𝗻𝘆 𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗽𝘀 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗿𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗹𝘂𝗱𝗲?
Typically, three. Cleansing, toning and moisturising. 
Gotta do your basics 😎

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
☘️ What does it mean to build products with 𝘴𝘰𝘶𝘭 ? [healthtech edition]

Another wonderful event hosted by Palta and learnt from inspiring speakers Thuria Wenbar, Konstantin Yakovlev, Kai Koch, Patrick Fagan and Dr. Ashish Patel, MD discussing the importance of building healthtech products with empathy.  

Some key takeaways:
🤖 Machine learning models give predictions, but a human makes the ultimate decision
🤖 Emotional intelligence (eg. chatbots) providing timely and relevant information with engagement retention
🧠 Mitigating risks and maximising benefits to patients with generative AI
🧠 Providing value at scale from digital to non-digital solutions by avoiding jargon and using human language

Building products is intuitive, but building products with empathy and soul makes non-human solutions humane. It connects with patients/ users more personally and empowers them on a meaningful level. 

𝘚𝘰𝘶𝘭 excited to see what the future holds! (sorry bad pun..)😮💨

#healthtech #healthcare #digitalhealth #ai #startup

Meet Magdalena B. 👋 
Palta's HR Operations Manager. Magda joined the team back in January and is currently based at Palta's office in the beautiful city of Warsaw.

Read on to learn more 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝗜𝘀 𝗶𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗳𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗧𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵? 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘆?
It is indeed. Healthy lifestyle is so important to me, that I should say, it’s been a major reason for me deciding to join Palta 💚

Palta provides a great amount of opportunities for personal growth and professional development. It massively supports young talent, so it is the perfect place for people who want to spread their wings.
I would like to quote Eminem here...: “𝙔𝙤𝙪 𝙤𝙣𝙡𝙮 𝙜𝙚𝙩 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙨𝙝𝙤𝙩, 𝙙𝙤 𝙣𝙤𝙩 𝙢𝙞𝙨𝙨 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙗𝙡𝙤𝙬. 𝙏𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙤𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙩𝙮 𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙨 𝙤𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙞𝙣 𝙖 𝙡𝙞𝙛𝙚𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚” 😉 

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗣𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗮?

🚰 Water is the most valuable life component on Earth, second only to air. While we cannot really forget to breathe, we do tend to ignore our daily need for staying hydrated. This #WorldWaterDay Andrew Belaveshkin MD PhD Palta's 💚 Medical Advisor offers three simple tactics for staying on the top of your game:

𝗔𝗱𝗷𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗪𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗕𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲
Always keep your water bottle handy, and if you do at any point feel or think that you might be thirsty just take a sip and see if this sensation enhances. If it does, then you do indeed need to replenish your biofluids reserves. 
This simple method of sample siping is highly effective and quick to adapt.

𝗘𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗪𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗕𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲
Dehydration manifests itself via multiple 🚩 red flags 🚩  - dry skin sensation, itchy eyes, dry mouth, muscle weakness, you name it! However the most accurate indicator is…the shade of urine. You may often not fully realize how thirsty you really are until you visit the bathroom (refer to the chart 👇).
For example, if you find yourself under a considerable amount of stress, the sensation of being thirsty can get dulled and go unnoticed for hours.This will immediately reflect in the color of a urine sample (unless you take certain daily vitamins and supplements). It’s key to mention that thirst disappears before your water deficiency gets fully compensated, so it is important to have access to water within the next 15-20 min after quenching your thirst.

𝗖𝗵𝗼𝗼𝘀𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗕𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗛𝘆𝗱𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗱
Herbal teas with fresh mint or lemon can also suffice. Some green tea, cacao, or even a couple cups of coffee ( ☕ ☕ not more) should do the trick.
Please remember that juices, milk and even plant based milk are poor sources of hydration. Sugary drinks will simply make you more thirsty.  So what is the best drink? Just water!

#healthtech #worldwaterday2023 #hydration #health

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Head Of Data Science
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
We did it again!!! We won!!!

The first place in Parkinson's Disease Progression Prediction competition on Kaggle.

1900 teams / 2000+ participants and 3 months timeline.

Three months seems a long period, but I didn't even notice how time flew — all because of my INCREDIBLE teammate Dmitry Gordeev. The word incredible is written with caps by no mistake — he is/was/hope will be again a perfect partner — one of the best DS I've ever met, super intelligent, dedicated, full of ideas, supportive and just a nice person.

I'm very very sorry to say that our solution will not be beneficial for patients with Parkinson's disease as we didn't find any stable signal in proteins and peptides. For such a small group of patients (600+) it is possible to find any (imaginable) correlation between patient health conditions and NPX with Peptide Abundance, even if no such correlation exists in reality. I'm sure that there is a "signal" in blood tests, but we need more data — much more data to make viable predictions.

Anyway, during the competition we've created some very interesting technics for SMAPE (SMAPE1p) optimization with GBT models (the complete approach will be described soon by Dmitry, I'll share the link when it's ready) and this part would be beneficial for many many companies that are using SMAPE as a target metric, for example in retail industry or LTV models. 

Congratulations to all the winners and participants it was a pleasure to compete with you. 

Thank you Kaggle and AMP-PD for hosting such an interesting competition.

https://lnkd.in/dWVrJShM

#ML #DS #Kaggle #SMAPE #Palta

Meet  Amir Levi 👋

In the blink of an eye, Amir swapped the familiar world of Gaming 🎮 to 💚 HealthTech and hasn’t looked back ever since. 
He joined Palta back in October ‘22 as a VP of Engagement & CRM. By many startup standards, almost eight months on the job qualify him now as an “all-knowing vet”.

Read on to learn more about Amir 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝗜𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗳𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵. 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘆?
Yes, it is. For most of my career, I worked in the online gaming space, specializing in gamification and habit-changing behavior, so to take this knowledge and use it to help users evolve, find the right mechanisms to get rid of their bad habits to improve their health was all very appealing to me.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝗿𝗲𝘁 𝘀𝗮𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 & 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻?
The truth is - users don’t care about your specific product or company. What they really want is to get help with achieving their own goals and needs. Understanding this helps to constantly develop features and communications tactics that are simple, clear and bring value to our customers.

𝗗𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗳𝘂𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗹𝘆? 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘀?
Yes, I am permanently based in sunny Israel, however I tend visit each  one of Palta's brands once every couple of months on average.
The pros are much better work life balance and day-to-day flexibility.
The cons are that it’s harder to create and maintain personal relationships without regular f2f meetings.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗣𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗮?
Help our portfolio companies to achieve their retention and monetization goals by building outstanding products and user communications.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗸𝗲𝘆 𝗾𝘂𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗲?
Creativity 🎨  along with an ability to think outside of the box 💡  - all of Palta's brands already have super talented CRM and Product teams that know their job from A to Z, so I really need to stay on the top of my game - be innovative in order to bring them value at an umbrella level and help them to create an impact at their individual levels.

#employeeexperience #healthtech #gaming #crmsolutions #crm #engagement #worklifebalance #startup

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
BIG NEWS for us at Flo and for data privacy for female health 🚨

Flo’s Anonymous Mode has been named a finalist of the Rapid Response category of Fast Company's 2023 World Changing Ideas Award. We created the Anonymous Mode feature as a direct response to our users’ concerns following the overturn of Roe v Wade last year. 

Flo already encrypts all data, engages in independent privacy audits, and recently received ISO 27001 certification, making Flo the first period and ovulation tracker to achieve this milestone. Flo’s Anonymous Mode introduces an even deeper layer of privacy for reproductive health data. 

The feature protects users’ sensitive reproductive health information by allowing them to use the app without their name, email, or technical identifiers (including IP address) being associated with the health data in their account. This feature was created in partnership with Cloudflare. 

Thank you to Fast Company for the recognition, and thanks to all of the Flo Health team members who helped make this feature available to our 50 million monthly active users around the world. 

#FCWorldChangingIdeas

company_updates_collection.description:
In his recent book “Outlive: The Science and Art of Longevity” 📖  Dr. Peter Attia  talks to a great extent about developing a personalized, proactive strategy for longevity. Among many tactics he mentions 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗚𝗹𝘂𝗰𝗼𝘀𝗲 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 (𝗖𝗚𝗠) as an effective method for managing one’s nutrition and behavior. 

With companies like ZOE democratizing access to CGM devices in the UK, the prospect of being able to adjust our diets in line with CGM data is becoming more achievable 💡 
 
𝗕𝘂𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗴𝗮𝗺𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗹𝗲? We’ve asked Andrew Belaveshkin MD PhD, Palta's 💚 Medical Advisor to comment on this trend:

To begin with, a post-meal measurement of the levels of glucose (Postprandial Blood Sugar) serves as a very important indicator of one’s metabolic health. Any deviation from the norm here is hard to spot otherwise, however it doesn’t mean it comes with no long-term consequences.

Elevated Postprandial Glucose has a negative effect on the lining of  blood vessels, causing oxidative stress and increasing the risk of cardiovascular disease. In addition, it can increase the level of chronic inflammation.
Worth mentioning, that spikes in glucose levels can also lead to accelerated aging through the accumulation of damaged molecules.

Interestingly, the glycemic response can vary from person to person. The volume of glucose spikes in response to particular food is highly individual and relies on a number of factors, like, for example, your microbiome, physical activity, sleep efficiency, day of the menstrual cycle, daylight exposure etc.

𝗪𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗽𝗲𝗼𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗴𝗲𝘁 𝗮𝗻𝘆 𝗯𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝘁 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗴𝗹𝘂𝗰𝗼𝘀𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴?
Undoubtedly, the first benefit is 💚 motivation 💚 

However, some further expectations of clinical effectiveness may not be justified. 
After all, you cannot simply rely on a single data point in isolation -  levels of glucose in the blood can be affected by psychological stress, cold air, dehydration, and dozens of other factors that are mostly out of our control.

Saying that, CGM can really help tweak your diet if you've already put in some hard yards maintaining some basic nutrition, exercise, sleep, work balance, and recovery routines.

In the meantime  I recommend following these simple steps for maintaining healthy glucose levels and flattening the glycemic curve:

🥗 𝗘𝗮𝘁 𝗟𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗲𝗿. Start with a salad, consume vegetables at every meal, avoid simple carbs, unless they are paired with greens or legumes.

🚶♂️ 𝗧𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗮 𝗦𝗵𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝗪𝗮𝗹𝗸 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗘𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆 𝗠𝗲𝗮𝗹. Just a 15 minute stroll  is enough to smooth out the spike in glucose. After a work lunch, spend an hour at a standing desk.

⚖ 𝗦𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝘁𝗼 𝗮 𝗡𝘂𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁-𝗥𝗶𝗰𝗵 𝗗𝗶𝗲𝘁. Regular fasting with a protein-packed breakfast tends to stabilize glucose levels for the whole day.

#healthtech #glucosemonitoring #nutrition #healthandwellness #motivation

"Investors say the UK is fast becoming the Silicon Valley of Europe’s HealthTech sector, with investment in the industry skyrocketing 🚀 to £3.1bn in 2021".

Meet Victor Stepanov 👋 
Victor heads 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 at one of Palta's most exciting products - Pora (a beauty and Health AI assistant developed to democratize dermatology and cosmetology services). 

Read on to learn more 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝗮 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗳𝗼𝗰𝘂𝘀 𝗮𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝗮?
It’s so exciting to work on a digital product that aims to change physical experience. 
For me, that’s the most rewarding part — to work on content that goes beyond digital. My focus at Pora is to make sure we build lean and scalable content production flow.

𝗜𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗹𝗱 𝗼𝗳 𝗶𝗻𝗳𝗹𝘂𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗿𝘀, 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿-𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗼𝗺𝘆 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗱 𝘀𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗶𝘀 𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗞𝗶𝗻𝗴?
I think Brand Content should evolve to stay relevant. It should bring value, become personalised and contextual. Brand Content has the power to connect audiences with meaningful insights and science-backed information about their health and wellness at a scale that is hard to beat if you’re an influencer or an independent creator.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝗾𝘂𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗲?
Constantly learn to do less to achieve more vs doing more to achieve less.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝗮?
Change people’s habits when it comes to choosing, buying and using cosmetics.

𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗿 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗽𝗮𝘀𝘁-𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳?
Learn to code 👨💻 

𝗕𝗼𝗻𝘂𝘀 𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻  𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗺𝗮𝗻𝘆 𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗽𝘀 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗿𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗹𝘂𝗱𝗲?

☘️ What does it mean to build products with 𝘴𝘰𝘶𝘭 ? [healthtech edition]

Another wonderful event hosted by Palta and learnt from inspiring speakers Thuria Wenbar, Konstantin Yakovlev, Kai Koch, Patrick Fagan and Dr. Ashish Patel, MD discussing the importance of building healthtech products with empathy.  

Some key takeaways:
🤖 Machine learning models give predictions, but a human makes the ultimate decision
🤖 Emotional intelligence (eg. chatbots) providing timely and relevant information with engagement retention
🧠 Mitigating risks and maximising benefits to patients with generative AI
🧠 Providing value at scale from digital to non-digital solutions by avoiding jargon and using human language

Building products is intuitive, but building products with empathy and soul makes non-human solutions humane. It connects with patients/ users more personally and empowers them on a meaningful level. 

𝘚𝘰𝘶𝘭 excited to see what the future holds! (sorry bad pun..)😮💨

#healthtech #healthcare #digitalhealth #ai #startup

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
How do you build a product with soul in Health Tech? 🤔

Yesterday, I had the pleasure of attending a Health Tech meet-up in London focused on building and scaling products with soul. The event brought together a diverse range of speakers from industry-leading companies such as Huma, Too Good To Go, AVIE, Stride.VC, and Peanut App.

Here are some key takeaways that resonated with me:

🌱 Foster a deep connection with your community to build a product that truly resonates with their needs, aspirations, and values.
💡 Discover your unique niche and pursue excellence within it, consistently delivering exceptional value and impact.
🤝 Collaborate with industry experts and thought leaders to infuse your product with diverse perspectives, expertise, and insights, creating a truly holistic solution.
💼 Prioritise finding the perfect market fit early on, investing the time and effort needed to deeply understand your target audience's pain points, desires, and behaviours.
🚀 Embrace technology and AI as powerful tools to enhance human connection, empathy, and personalisation in your product, empowering users to achieve their health and wellness goals.

Attending this event reaffirmed my belief in the transformative power of Health Tech. It reminded me that building a product with soul goes beyond technology — it requires a deep understanding of people's needs and a commitment to creating meaningful impact in their lives.

Thank you Palta for organising such a great event!

#healthtech #innovation #startup #entrepreneurship #founders

Meet  Elizabeth K.  👋

She recently swapped buzzy New York City for London and joined one of Palta's portfolio companies Simple App earlier this year as the Chief of Staff. 

Read on to learn more about Elizabeth 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝗪𝗵𝘆 𝗦𝗜𝗠𝗣𝗟𝗘?
Fitness and nutrition is something I’m passionate about. 
I work with a personal trainer and have had my own journey with nutrition / body image when I was younger. For me, food is an experience, it’s culture, it’s nourishment. 
It’s great to be at a company that is dedicated to helping people achieve their weight and health goals without pushing them towards unhealthy relationship choices with food 💜 

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗳 𝗼𝗳 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗳𝗳 (𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗰𝘂𝘀 𝗮𝘁 𝗦𝗜𝗠𝗣𝗟𝗘) ?
I think the role of Chief of Staff is really about how you can help the CEO make the company a better company - pushing leaders to set the right goals and unblocking teams from the obstacles in reaching those goals. 
Thus far, I’ve been working on fixing the planning system and process so that they’re centred around ambitious KPIs and prioritization.
I’ve also created a system for the company and team roadmaps to become interlinked and more transparent, so people understand how their work rolls up into our high level KPIs. 

𝗢𝗻𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝘃𝗲 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝘁 𝗮𝘁 𝗰𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝗯𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗿𝗲𝗹𝗲𝘃𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗿?
One of my professors said it best - “𝙨𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡 𝙞𝙨𝙣’𝙩 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙬𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣, 𝙞𝙩’𝙨 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙝𝙤𝙬 𝙩𝙤 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣”. I’ve had many different experiences in my career from investment banking to growth marketing to now Chief of Staff at Simple App, and the common thread has always been figuring out how to solve new problems. 

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗻 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗸𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗯𝗲𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗨𝗞 ?
I appreciate that London 🇬🇧  is very international. 
I’ve become friends with people from all walks of life which is fun. I love that it’s easier to explore more of Europe from London than from New York 🇺🇸  (where I’m originally from). 

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗦𝗜𝗠𝗣𝗟𝗘?
The most important thing I’d like to achieve is to foster a culture of ownership and excellence all while breaking down the silos between teams. 
At the end of the day, what makes or breaks a company are the people - we need to ensure that our people have the right mindset, rigor and love towards their work. 

#career #healthtech #chiefofstaff #startup #learning #nutrition #employeeexperience #womenintech

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Head Of Data Science
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
We did it again!!! We won!!!

The first place in Parkinson's Disease Progression Prediction competition on Kaggle.

1900 teams / 2000+ participants and 3 months timeline.

Three months seems a long period, but I didn't even notice how time flew — all because of my INCREDIBLE teammate Dmitry Gordeev. The word incredible is written with caps by no mistake — he is/was/hope will be again a perfect partner — one of the best DS I've ever met, super intelligent, dedicated, full of ideas, supportive and just a nice person.

I'm very very sorry to say that our solution will not be beneficial for patients with Parkinson's disease as we didn't find any stable signal in proteins and peptides. For such a small group of patients (600+) it is possible to find any (imaginable) correlation between patient health conditions and NPX with Peptide Abundance, even if no such correlation exists in reality. I'm sure that there is a "signal" in blood tests, but we need more data — much more data to make viable predictions.

Anyway, during the competition we've created some very interesting technics for SMAPE (SMAPE1p) optimization with GBT models (the complete approach will be described soon by Dmitry, I'll share the link when it's ready) and this part would be beneficial for many many companies that are using SMAPE as a target metric, for example in retail industry or LTV models. 

Congratulations to all the winners and participants it was a pleasure to compete with you. 

Thank you Kaggle and AMP-PD for hosting such an interesting competition.

https://lnkd.in/dWVrJShM

#ML #DS #Kaggle #SMAPE #Palta

Meet  Amir Levi 👋

In the blink of an eye, Amir swapped the familiar world of Gaming 🎮 to 💚 HealthTech and hasn’t looked back ever since. 
He joined Palta back in October ‘22 as a VP of Engagement & CRM. By many startup standards, almost eight months on the job qualify him now as an “all-knowing vet”.

Read on to learn more about Amir 👇 and follow #lifeatpalta #teampalta for more employee stories.

𝗜𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗳𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻 𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵. 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘆?
Yes, it is. For most of my career, I worked in the online gaming space, specializing in gamification and habit-changing behavior, so to take this knowledge and use it to help users evolve, find the right mechanisms to get rid of their bad habits to improve their health was all very appealing to me.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝗿𝗲𝘁 𝘀𝗮𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 & 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻?
The truth is - users don’t care about your specific product or company. What they really want is to get help with achieving their own goals and needs. Understanding this helps to constantly develop features and communications tactics that are simple, clear and bring value to our customers.

𝗗𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗳𝘂𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗹𝘆? 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘀?
Yes, I am permanently based in sunny Israel, however I tend visit each  one of Palta's brands once every couple of months on average.
The pros are much better work life balance and day-to-day flexibility.
The cons are that it’s harder to create and maintain personal relationships without regular f2f meetings.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝗱𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗣𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗮?
Help our portfolio companies to achieve their retention and monetization goals by building outstanding products and user communications.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
BIG NEWS for us at Flo and for data privacy for female health 🚨

Flo’s Anonymous Mode has been named a finalist of the Rapid Response category of Fast Company's 2023 World Changing Ideas Award. We created the Anonymous Mode feature as a direct response to our users’ concerns following the overturn of Roe v Wade last year. 

Flo already encrypts all data, engages in independent privacy audits, and recently received ISO 27001 certification, making Flo the first period and ovulation tracker to achieve this milestone. Flo’s Anonymous Mode introduces an even deeper layer of privacy for reproductive health data. 

The feature protects users’ sensitive reproductive health information by allowing them to use the app without their name, email, or technical identifiers (including IP address) being associated with the health data in their account. This feature was created in partnership with Cloudflare. 

Thank you to Fast Company for the recognition, and thanks to all of the Flo Health team members who helped make this feature available to our 50 million monthly active users around the world. 

#FCWorldChangingIdeas
