Our users wanted us to make our food tracking system better. So we listened and got to work. Incorporating AI into our already-smart #tech is changing the game for how we support our users, and we’re super excited to share some new features with you today!  

🍏🥐🍅 INTRODUCING … our new and improved Food Tracker 

Logging food with SIMPLE is now easier, more intuitive, and quick as a flash. Instead of scrolling a food database, users can just type in what they ate, snap a photo of their meal, or describe it using their voice. 

We’re stoked with this update. But what comes next is even BETTER. 

🟢🟠🟡 INTRODUCING … our new Nutrition Scores and food feedback 

Once a user has logged their food, it’s analyzed by our algorithm, which has been designed alongside our in-house science team to reflect well-established #nutrition guidelines. Each food is assessed in terms of nutritional factors that influence weight and health to give the user a Nutrition Score of Low, Fair, Good, or Optimal. This shows the overall nutritional quality of their meal. They can also see a daily Score, which is the average of all meal Scores logged that day. 

We designed Nutrition Scores based on our belief that no food is either “good” or “bad.” These Scores don’t judge our users or their food choices. They’re designed to guide — not guilt — them toward a healthier, more balanced diet over time, bringing their goals even more within reach. #nutritionmatters

📲 INTRODUCING … our redesigned Home screen that guides users on what to do today, saving them time, and confusion, and smoothing out the bumpy road of building new habits. 

Now when users tap open their app, they have these key features in one place: 
📲 the day’s average Nutrition Score and logged meals
📲 a button to log new meals (and edit previously logged meals)
📲 where they are in their eating or fasting window
📲 buttons to start or stop their fast or change their daily intermittent fasting schedule 

🥑 DON’T FORGET … Avo, our recently launched AI-powered nutrition chatbot

A final shout-out to Avo, who’s on hand 24/7 to answer your wellness questions! Avo’s now living its best life in the SIMPLE app, helping users zhuzh up their meals, feel more relaxed when stress-eating flares up, and stay motivated on their weight loss journey.

Launching these brand-new features in our SIMPLE app feels like Christmas Day: we can’t wait for our users’ to try them! We keep moving closer to our vision of making improved health accessible to all, working day by day on our mission of translating cutting-edge nutritional science and tech into simple, everyday solutions. 

The Food Tracker and Nutrition Scores are already available to all our English users, but the Home screen updates are currently only available in the English iOS version of the app. More languages (French, German, Italian, Portuguese, and Spanish) and Android are coming soon! 

👉 https://lnkd.in/dCtF9UwP

company_updates_collection.description:
This January, Flo's monthly active audience reached 62 million! It is the biggest app by MAU in the Health & Fitness category worldwide.
Based on the speed of growth of the audience, Flo's active user base will surpass the total population of the UK, the country where our headquarters is based, in several months. 
In the US, 1 in 6 women (13-45 yo) use Flo (our MAU in the US represents 17% of the population). 
Last year, Flo added more than 10 M new monthly active users. Is it a significant number? A stand-alone app with 10 M MAU would be in the TOP 10 of the Health and fitness category (and more than 100,000 apps in the H&F category are available).
As you see from the graph, the audience growth in Flo is stable and steady. The reason: our product has very healthy retention. Users love it and have used it for years. Close to 60% of Monthly Active Users have used Flo for over a year. It is extremely rare for consumer-facing apps to retain users so well, especially from the Health & Fitness category. 
As our TAM is huge, Flo still has many years to grow. We believe that in the future, our active audience will be measured in hundreds of millions. Or a billion? Why not, if TAM allows that and the product is the best?

2023 was Flo's biggest year to date. Here's why.

Last year, we made great strides towards our ambition of building a better future for female health:
- Flo's monthly active users grew by 12 million — from 48M to 60M, surpassing 10M in the United States
- We donated over 11M free Flo Premium subscriptions to improve health literacy in countries where it is most needed
- We were the largest health app globally in terms of MAU and installs for the 4th year in a row
- Annual revenue grew to over $140m – a 40% increase on 2022, with December ARR surpassing $192m. We aim to grow this number by 50% in 2024.
- In Q4, Flo reached profitability and is now a fully self-sustainable company.

Our hardworking team also launched two groundbreaking new features:

🔎 Symptom Checker — to help women identify if their symptoms might be connected with a reproductive health condition like PCOS or Endometriosis
💞 Flo for Partners (our most requested feature ever!) — to help women educate their partners about their cycle health

Another huge highlight was learning that Flo’s’ Anonymous Mode won the prestigious Time Innovation Award and the Fast Company World Changing Ideas Award.

We cannot wait to achieve even more in 2024. Thank you to the entire Flo team for contributing to Flo’s mission and our users. Here’s to an even bigger 2024!

Fancy joining our award-winning team here at Flo? We’re hiring: https://lnkd.in/eDPcMipg

Come with us as we rub our crystal ball and explore 5 wellness trends for 2024, predicted by our Chief Nutrition Officer Ro Huntriss and the Science team at SIMPLE. Check out our blog for more. 

⚖️ 1. LOOKING BEYOND THE SCALE ⚖️ 
In 2024, it’s high time we put body weight and BMI into context and decentered weight loss as the main purpose of living a healthy lifestyle. We’re seeing restrictive diets wane in popularity, and a growing desire for sustainable habits that support our overall well-being. 

💜 Our 2024 prediction: 
We’ll embrace health as a multi-faceted mix of factors and move further away from chasing the scale number as if it’s the only thing that matters. As staunch members of #TeamSelfCare, we couldn’t be more excited by this shift. 

🌎 2. EATING FOR PLANET HEALTH 🌎
A recent research review found that ultra-processed foods (UPFs) contribute more than other food groups to greenhouse gas emissions and account for 36–45% of total diet-related biodiversity loss. It’s increasingly clear that eating in a more environmentally-sustainable way means eating more plants and fewer UPFS. 

💜 Our 2024 prediction: 
We’ll find new ways of creating healthy, environmentally sustainable diets.

🩸 3. EMBRACING PERIOD POSITIVITY 🩸 
Conversations around periods and menstrual health are becoming more mainstream, putting menstrual health firmly on the global agenda, and driving creative solutions in period products, clothing, and self-care.

💜 Our 2024 prediction: 
Empowering women, girls, and all those who menstruate to understand, openly discuss, and feel good about their bodies’ needs is something we wholeheartedly support, and we’re confident our colleagues over at the Flo app will be leading the charge! 

😌 4. SOOTHING STRESS WITH SELF-CARE 😌
With the pandemic only just in the rear view mirror; 2023’s heavy layoffs, job insecurity, and financial pressures; plus kickback from our constantly-connected digital lives, our mental health is under mounting pressure. 

In response, we’re taking more control. An Instagram survey found that one of Gen Z’s top priorities in 2024 is staying healthy, and the Global Wellness Institute saying we’re investing more money into self-care than ever.

💜 Our 2024 prediction: 
We’ll tackle our ever-growing list of stressors with increasing determination. 

🤖 5. HARNESSING AI FOR HEALTH 🤖 
By analyzing real-time data to optimize our experience, AI can help us have more satisfying and productive practices across many areas of health — meditation, fitness, nutrition, stress, sleep, etc. — without the hefty price tag often associated with 1-2-1 coaching. 

💜 Our 2024 prediction: 
We’ll see AI being used more for personalized support and coaching. At SIMPLE, we’ve got big plans for Avo, our wellness assistant! 

https://lnkd.in/dKqfHguf

Why we made Flo Premium completely free for 1bn women worldwide…

Back in October 2022, we announced that we’d be giving Flo Premium to women across 22 countries — including Ethiopia, Haiti, and Nepal — at no cost to them. 

Now, we’re expanding the Pass It On Project further to give the power of health literacy to more women living in countries where access to safe and credible health information is limited.

Flo’s mission is to build a better future for female health, but studies, surveys, and health outcomes show us that there's still a long way to go. While 70% of women in India report menstrual health issues, a concerning 82% of girls in Malawi reported having no knowledge of menstruation before their first period.

As of today:
📋1 billion women will now have access to Flo Premium completely free
🌍 44 new countries can now benefit, including India, Indonesia, and Nigeria
💝10 million+ women worldwide are using Flo Premium for free today

We look forward to a brighter future, one with better health and fertility outcomes for women worldwide.

To every existing paying Premium member — thank you. It’s because of you that we can make this global movement possible. 

For more information, visit: https://lnkd.in/dMKq38DP

Flo anonymous mode - the invention of the year by Time!

https://lnkd.in/eev4nViF

Wow! What an experience it was in Dallas, Texas for Obesity Week! It was my first time at this conference and I have to say it’s one of the best conferences I’ve been to.

The perfect platform to share the story of the Simple App, the research we do and our grand ambitions, in addition to presenting our second conference abstract.

With travelling solo and not knowing many people at the conference, a special thanks must go to the Allurion Technologies team Paul Sacher (PhD) Jen Pain Bill Nadeau, MS, RD Jeff Feldgoise  for adopting me, entertaining me and introducing me to so many amazing people. 

I’ve got some digesting to do, thinking about how we can apply the many fascinating concepts discussed into the future development of Simple 💫 

Great to see / meet Giles Yeo Elanor Hinton Volkan Demirhan Yumuk Katie Ellison, MS, RDN, LDN Sean Wharton Diana Thomas M. Christopher Griffith, M.D. Camilla Easter Professor Hutan Ashrafian Terese Torstensson Caterina Conte and many more! 💫

Today marks the official launch of Flo for Partners, the #1 most requested feature by Flo’s 58 million monthly active users.

As the world's leading women's health app, Flo’s mission is to create a better future for female health. With Flo for Partners, we are expanding our commitment to revolutionizing women's health by offering science-backed insights to couples seeking to improve their sex life, increase their chances of conceiving, or share their pregnancy journey. 

Our recent survey of nearly 2k American men found that over half feel that their sex education during adolescence was insufficient, and one-third report that insufficient sex education has led to unrealistic expectations and difficulty in communicating about sex. 

Flo for Partners addresses this knowledge gap head-on by providing medical insights, authored and vetted by Flo's team of over 120+ medical experts, and proactive tips to the partner's app. These insights and tips aim to enhance the partner's ability to support and understand their female partner, both physically and emotionally. 

As of today, Flo for Partners is available on both iOS and Android platforms. Follow the link to find out more about Flo for Partners: https://lnkd.in/eKMxXp-a

company_updates_collection.description:
Last night in London, we had the privilege of hosting an event as part of the "Create What You Wish Existed" series. It was an evening defined by quality, exclusivity, and the forward-looking vision of our guest speaker, Yuri Gurski.

Yuri, the CEO and Board Member at Palta and the Founder and President at Flo Health Inc., graced us with his presence and shared his insights. Palta, a multi-product technology company, boasts over 60 million monthly active users, and Flo Health Inc., their flagship product, is the #1 health app in the world, with over 300 million downloads.

During his talk, Yuri delved into the paradigm shift in the business landscape driven by AI and empathetic AI-driven products. He painted a picture of how these innovations will reshape productivity, health, and even dating in the coming years.

But what truly set this event apart was Yuri's emphasis on outliers - those who defy conventional success and operate at the extreme edges of possibility. He expressed a keen interest in those who possess exceptional intelligence and are ready to drive change in their respective fields.

Yuri also shed light on how Palta collaborates with and supports such outliers to lead the business shift trend in their domains. With more than a dozen new product ideas on the horizon, Palta's potential knows no bounds.

The evening was a gathering for individuals passionate about innovation, AI technology, and shaping the future. It featured a talk, a Q&A session, and networking opportunities with like-minded founders and tech professionals.

This event marked a milestone in our "Create What You Wish Existed" series, which has previously hosted founders like Sam Altman, Nik Storonsky, Michael Acton Smith, and more. The quest for knowledge and the drive to create a brighter future unite us all.

Thank you to everyone who joined us for this evening of learning and networking. Stay tuned for more events that push the boundaries of innovation!

#Innovation #AI #Tech #CreateWhatYouWishExisted #Palta #Yuri #Outliers #FutureShapers #Networking #LondonEvents #Flo

It's time to put on our party hats and celebrate our 3rd birthday 🎉  

Over the past three years, our mission to revolutionize how people approach health and wellness has been an incredible journey. We are proud to share some highlights from our exciting adventure:

🌟 From humble beginnings, we have transformed into an affordable interactive fitness app that is changing lives

📲 Over the past three years, our app has been downloaded over 1 million times, reaching fitness enthusiasts around the globe 

🏋️♀️ We have curated a library of 400+ guided exercises

📈 Our innovative Body Composition Scan lets users track their progress and make informed decisions about their health and wellness goals

🏃♂️ We have developed cutting-edge Motion-Tracking Fitness Tests to help our users unlock their fitness goals and reduce injury risk

🤝 Our team has grown to include 70 talented individuals who are passionate about making fitness accessible to all

None of these achievements would have been possible without the trust and support of our amazing users. We want to express our deepest gratitude to each and every one of you for being a part of our fitness revolution. 🙏

As we celebrate this milestone, we renew our commitment to continuous improvement and providing you with the best fitness experience possible. 💚

#fitness #birthday #wellness

I love it when I’m wrong about a new feature. When we launched Flo for Partners last year, I expected that it would be popular; it was the most requested Flo feature of all time! I also hoped that it would be a useful communication tool for relationships, together with helping couples conceive. But what I didn’t expect was that men would have +40% higher retention rates than their partners. Given Flo is a female health app, this is staggering. What makes it even more impressive is that Flo has very, very good retention in the case of core users as well, which has made it the biggest health and fitness app in the world, with 62 million active users. We’re still in the process of rolling this feature out to all languages, but there are already 11,000 partners per day installing Flo.

Flo for Partners is designed to empower partners with scientific insights into their female partner's menstrual and reproductive health. What we’re seeing is that male partners are so engaged in learning about their partner’s menstrual cycles. Our ambition is that this leads not only to better communication between partners, but better empathy for female health in society as a whole.

Women’s health is not just a women’s health issue, it’s a shared responsibility that benefits everyone. Here’s what one user had to say about how Flo for Partners has improved his understanding of his partner and overall relationship:

“The most beneficial aspect of the app on a personal level, is being given that frame of reference to how she really feels without her having to directly remind me. Whether it be more sad, more angry or frustrated, or even more loving, it builds in a whole new layer of consideration, that helps me adjust my own behavior to accommodate her needs better (ideally). With a little reminder that basically says "hey here's how she is feeling today" it makes it a lot easier to have empathy, and gives me the cheat codes to potentially make a positive difference in the quality of our day.” - Jacob, 24

Well-being and women’s health specifically are in the focus and are part of Vision 2030, as is our commitment to make our products available for 1 billion people globally. We’re grateful to our colleagues for their warm hospitality.
Waddah Albassam Reem AlNafisah CICP / CInS /IMBA/IMYB Dusan Duffek

In April, Flo's Partner Mode reached a significant milestone: 1,000,000 monthly active users. The popularity of Partner Mode is growing, and in the last 30 days, we had half of a million additional organic installs because of it. 

This feature is new, the first MVP was launched just 6 months ago. But it is already evident: the potential of the Partner Mode is huge. Flo has always had a tremendously large TAM (it is the primary reason why it is the biggest Health&Fitness app in the world with 65 million MAU). But the success of the partner mode makes our total addressable market MUCH MUCH bigger because of men!

We plan that the Flo Partner Mode will have content and tracking for men's health soon. It will make this product to be one of the most significant players in the field of male health (by MAU).

We're looking for a product manager who really meets the bar with product experience: used to working with a full squad of product designers, UX researchers and analysts plus engineers and shipping features, knows how to make MVPs, do iterative product development, and run experiments. But we also want experience working with ML/data scientists and LLMs as they need to be hands-on working with our AI team. 

It’s also London or Vilnius-based, though we could look at Poland for the right person. 

Apply on the website, and if we know each other, I'll gladly refer you!

Kudos to team Flo for a stellar Q1 performance 🌟 

I’m pleased to say our hard work and dedication have paid off with some remarkable achievements:
📈 our absolute record - 63% growth in monthly revenue year on year (March)
📊 50% growth in quarterly revenue year on year
🙋♀️Flo reached an incredible milestone of 65 million monthly active users, growing by over 5 million in Q1 alone! It is our record as well

Join me in celebrating this phenomenal success, and let's continue empowering millions worldwide with personalized health insights and support 💪 #FloHealth
Go Zing team!

#fitness #wellness

company_updates_collection.description:
It's time to put on our party hats and celebrate our 3rd birthday 🎉  

Over the past three years, our mission to revolutionize how people approach health and wellness has been an incredible journey. We are proud to share some highlights from our exciting adventure:

🌟 From humble beginnings, we have transformed into an affordable interactive fitness app that is changing lives

📲 Over the past three years, our app has been downloaded over 1 million times, reaching fitness enthusiasts around the globe 

🏋️♀️ We have curated a library of 400+ guided exercises

📈 Our innovative Body Composition Scan lets users track their progress and make informed decisions about their health and wellness goals

🏃♂️ We have developed cutting-edge Motion-Tracking Fitness Tests to help our users unlock their fitness goals and reduce injury risk

🤝 Our team has grown to include 70 talented individuals who are passionate about making fitness accessible to all

None of these achievements would have been possible without the trust and support of our amazing users. We want to express our deepest gratitude to each and every one of you for being a part of our fitness revolution. 🙏

As we celebrate this milestone, we renew our commitment to continuous improvement and providing you with the best fitness experience possible. 💚

#fitness #birthday #wellness

Happy International Women’s Day to all the wonderful ladies here! 🌸
Since day one, we’ve been all about designing products with women in mind. Our team rocks a 1:1 women to men ratio at the group level, beating the tech industry’s average by miles!
Here’s to making every day feel like spring - fresh, vibrant, and full of possibilities.
May your hearts be as light and hopeful as the first day of spring. Let’s keep blooming together! 🌷💪🏽

I love it when I’m wrong about a new feature. When we launched Flo for Partners last year, I expected that it would be popular; it was the most requested Flo feature of all time! I also hoped that it would be a useful communication tool for relationships, together with helping couples conceive. But what I didn’t expect was that men would have +40% higher retention rates than their partners. Given Flo is a female health app, this is staggering. What makes it even more impressive is that Flo has very, very good retention in the case of core users as well, which has made it the biggest health and fitness app in the world, with 62 million active users. We’re still in the process of rolling this feature out to all languages, but there are already 11,000 partners per day installing Flo.

Flo for Partners is designed to empower partners with scientific insights into their female partner's menstrual and reproductive health. What we’re seeing is that male partners are so engaged in learning about their partner’s menstrual cycles. Our ambition is that this leads not only to better communication between partners, but better empathy for female health in society as a whole.

Women’s health is not just a women’s health issue, it’s a shared responsibility that benefits everyone. Here’s what one user had to say about how Flo for Partners has improved his understanding of his partner and overall relationship:

“The most beneficial aspect of the app on a personal level, is being given that frame of reference to how she really feels without her having to directly remind me. Whether it be more sad, more angry or frustrated, or even more loving, it builds in a whole new layer of consideration, that helps me adjust my own behavior to accommodate her needs better (ideally). With a little reminder that basically says "hey here's how she is feeling today" it makes it a lot easier to have empathy, and gives me the cheat codes to potentially make a positive difference in the quality of our day.” - Jacob, 24

Happy International Women’s Day to all the wonderful ladies here! 🌸
Since day one, we’ve been all about designing products with women in mind. Our team rocks a 1:1 women to men ratio at the group level, beating the tech industry’s average by miles!
Here’s to making every day feel like spring - fresh, vibrant, and full of possibilities.
May your hearts be as light and hopeful as the first day of spring. Let’s keep blooming together! 🌷💪🏽

Simple App released NutriScanner! The feature enables users to scan restaurant menus. NutriScanner creates a color-coded nutrition score that helps people better understand their food options.

Simple is the second-largest business within Palta after Flo, which grew 70% last year.

Today, we are excited to announce that Flo has secured over $200 million from the globally renowned equity firm, General Atlantic, which manages assets exceeding $80 billion. With this investment, Flo has reached a valuation of over $1 billion, achieving unicorn status.

We are proud to share that one in four women in the United States use Flo. It is the most downloaded app in the Health & Fitness category, and as of June 2024, it supports nearly 70 million monthly active users and close to 5 million paid subscribers. Additionally, millions of children have been born with the help of Flo.

For me, this achievement is particularly meaningful as it demonstrates that great success can be built on products that truly benefit people.

I am especially happy that it was Charles F. Feeney, an American entrepreneur and philanthropist, who founded General Atlantic. He has been a uniquely influential figure with a tremendous impact on the world and Flo could not have wanted a better partner than his legacy General Atlantic.

We are confident that the past ten years, from my initial idea in an Excel sheet to becoming the world’s largest health app, are just the beginning for Flo. With our new partners, we’re excited to elevate Flo to new level and fulfill our mission to revolutionize women's healthy.

At Palta, we are thrilled to announce a monumental achievement for one of our flagship products, Flo Health Inc. Flo has successfully raised over $200 million in Series C funding, led by General Atlantic, an 80+B, leading global growth equity firm. With Flo’s valuation now reaching beyond 1 billion, Flo joins the elite ranks of femtech unicorns  — a milestone I am so proud to be part of.

Since its inception as part of the Palta family, Flo has consistently demonstrated exceptional growth and impact. Today, Flo is the most downloaded app in the Health & Fitness category and supports nearly 70 million monthly active users as well as close to 5 million paid subscribers. 1 in 4 US women use Flo, showcasing its widespread adoption and the critical need it fulfills in women's health services. Flo's success is a testament to our mission at Palta of transforming innovative ideas into life-changing apps. We're immensely proud of the Flo team and their unwavering commitment to improving women's health globally.

General Atlantic’s deep expertise and commitment to fostering innovation make them an ideal partner for Flo. With more than 40 years of experience partnering with visionary founders and high-growth businesses to help them scale,  General Atlantic has significant experience in Consumer Subscription businesses (CLEAR, Duolingo, Chess.com, Quizlet, Squarespace), as well as healthcare. Given that the femtech industry is poised to be a $60 billion industry by 2027, we are well positioned to revolutionize women's health and make a lasting impact on global health outcomes worldwide.

As we celebrate this milestone, we look forward to continuing our support for Flo and our other portfolio companies in their journey to revolutionize global health and wellness through technology. Congratulations to the entire Flo team, fellow investors, and most importantly, to the millions of women who will benefit from Flo's continued growth and innovation.

We believe that a successful weight loss journey is based in simplicity and building healthy habits. That’s why a year ago we created Avo, an AI health coach to guide users each day and answer their nutrition questions. But we still see people spending too much time...

... 😕 Worrying about what to order when dining out
... 🥦 Feeling uninspired about what to cook at home
... 😪 Manually logging meals

So today, we’re excited to introduce Avo Vision to the coaching experience. With just a quick photo, you can:
😁 Scan menus for instant suggestions to fit your goals
🥗 Get recipes or tips based on what you photograph
🍣 Easily log or share meals for constructive feedback

Our objective is simple: To take away the weight loss worry, and help people enjoy food while still empowering them to reach their goals. 

Want to see Avo Vision in action? Download the latest version of the Simple app today 📲 https://bit.ly/3WxSJLb

📈 our absolute record - 63% growth in monthly revenue year on year (March)
📊 50% growth in quarterly revenue year on year
🙋♀️Flo reached an incredible milestone of 65 million monthly active users, growing by over 5 million in Q1 alone! It is our record as well

Join me in celebrating this phenomenal success, and let's continue empowering millions worldwide with personalized health insights and support 💪 #FloHealth
Go Zing team!

company_updates_collection.description:
It's time to put on our party hats and celebrate our 3rd birthday 🎉  

Over the past three years, our mission to revolutionize how people approach health and wellness has been an incredible journey. We are proud to share some highlights from our exciting adventure:

🌟 From humble beginnings, we have transformed into an affordable interactive fitness app that is changing lives

📲 Over the past three years, our app has been downloaded over 1 million times, reaching fitness enthusiasts around the globe 

🏋️♀️ We have curated a library of 400+ guided exercises

📈 Our innovative Body Composition Scan lets users track their progress and make informed decisions about their health and wellness goals

🏃♂️ We have developed cutting-edge Motion-Tracking Fitness Tests to help our users unlock their fitness goals and reduce injury risk

🤝 Our team has grown to include 70 talented individuals who are passionate about making fitness accessible to all

None of these achievements would have been possible without the trust and support of our amazing users. We want to express our deepest gratitude to each and every one of you for being a part of our fitness revolution. 🙏

As we celebrate this milestone, we renew our commitment to continuous improvement and providing you with the best fitness experience possible. 💚

#fitness #birthday #wellness

Today, we are excited to announce that Flo has secured over $200 million from the globally renowned equity firm, General Atlantic, which manages assets exceeding $80 billion. With this investment, Flo has reached a valuation of over $1 billion, achieving unicorn status.

We are proud to share that one in four women in the United States use Flo. It is the most downloaded app in the Health & Fitness category, and as of June 2024, it supports nearly 70 million monthly active users and close to 5 million paid subscribers. Additionally, millions of children have been born with the help of Flo.

For me, this achievement is particularly meaningful as it demonstrates that great success can be built on products that truly benefit people.

I am especially happy that it was Charles F. Feeney, an American entrepreneur and philanthropist, who founded General Atlantic. He has been a uniquely influential figure with a tremendous impact on the world and Flo could not have wanted a better partner than his legacy General Atlantic.

We are confident that the past ten years, from my initial idea in an Excel sheet to becoming the world’s largest health app, are just the beginning for Flo. With our new partners, we’re excited to elevate Flo to new level and fulfill our mission to revolutionize women's healthy.

At Palta, we are thrilled to announce a monumental achievement for one of our flagship products, Flo Health Inc. Flo has successfully raised over $200 million in Series C funding, led by General Atlantic, an 80+B, leading global growth equity firm. With Flo’s valuation now reaching beyond 1 billion, Flo joins the elite ranks of femtech unicorns  — a milestone I am so proud to be part of.

Since its inception as part of the Palta family, Flo has consistently demonstrated exceptional growth and impact. Today, Flo is the most downloaded app in the Health & Fitness category and supports nearly 70 million monthly active users as well as close to 5 million paid subscribers. 1 in 4 US women use Flo, showcasing its widespread adoption and the critical need it fulfills in women's health services. Flo's success is a testament to our mission at Palta of transforming innovative ideas into life-changing apps. We're immensely proud of the Flo team and their unwavering commitment to improving women's health globally.

General Atlantic’s deep expertise and commitment to fostering innovation make them an ideal partner for Flo. With more than 40 years of experience partnering with visionary founders and high-growth businesses to help them scale,  General Atlantic has significant experience in Consumer Subscription businesses (CLEAR, Duolingo, Chess.com, Quizlet, Squarespace), as well as healthcare. Given that the femtech industry is poised to be a $60 billion industry by 2027, we are well positioned to revolutionize women's health and make a lasting impact on global health outcomes worldwide.

As we celebrate this milestone, we look forward to continuing our support for Flo and our other portfolio companies in their journey to revolutionize global health and wellness through technology. Congratulations to the entire Flo team, fellow investors, and most importantly, to the millions of women who will benefit from Flo's continued growth and innovation.

We believe that a successful weight loss journey is based in simplicity and building healthy habits. That’s why a year ago we created Avo, an AI health coach to guide users each day and answer their nutrition questions. But we still see people spending too much time...

... 😕 Worrying about what to order when dining out
... 🥦 Feeling uninspired about what to cook at home
... 😪 Manually logging meals

So today, we’re excited to introduce Avo Vision to the coaching experience. With just a quick photo, you can:
😁 Scan menus for instant suggestions to fit your goals
🥗 Get recipes or tips based on what you photograph
🍣 Easily log or share meals for constructive feedback

Our objective is simple: To take away the weight loss worry, and help people enjoy food while still empowering them to reach their goals. 

Want to see Avo Vision in action? Download the latest version of the Simple app today 📲 https://bit.ly/3WxSJLb

We are actively looking for talented individuals to join our dynamic team! 🚀

If you're passionate, driven, and eager to make a difference, we want to hear from you.

Currently, we have a wide range of exciting job opportunities waiting for you in both Warsaw and Limassol, with the added flexibility of remote work options.

Apply here 👉 https://lnkd.in/dWx92YwB

In April, Flo's Partner Mode reached a significant milestone: 1,000,000 monthly active users. The popularity of Partner Mode is growing, and in the last 30 days, we had half of a million additional organic installs because of it. 

This feature is new, the first MVP was launched just 6 months ago. But it is already evident: the potential of the Partner Mode is huge. Flo has always had a tremendously large TAM (it is the primary reason why it is the biggest Health&Fitness app in the world with 65 million MAU). But the success of the partner mode makes our total addressable market MUCH MUCH bigger because of men!

We plan that the Flo Partner Mode will have content and tracking for men's health soon. It will make this product to be one of the most significant players in the field of male health (by MAU).

Dmitry Gurski, CEO of Flo Health Inc., says this is the "best interview he has ever had". "It was a very candid and open discussion, even emotional for some moments".

Highly recommended!
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: Flo Health, CEO & co-founder
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Harry Stebbings, the founder of the 20VC podcast and fund, asked me at the end of our conversation: “What do you believe most people around disbelieve.” I answered that most people believe in talent, but I do not; I firmly believe that behind any brilliance are thousands of hours of hard and focused work. The ability to gain more hours of such work than peers defines talent. 

And Harry himself is the best embodiment of this belief. He started his podcast when he was 18, and up to this moment, he has done 2700+ interviews. With such an experience, he is really good at what he does; people would say, “he has a talent.” 

My interview with Harry is the best I have ever had. It was a very candid and open discussion, even emotional for some moments. Harry wrote on Twitter, "One of the best we have done." I don't know the share of flattery in this statement, and it is for you to gauge. 

The link to the podcast:
